mcqs.explanation: Speed = 240/24 = 10 m/sec.Required time = (240 + 650)/10 = 89 sec.

mcqs.question: The length of the bridge, which a train 130 m long and traveling at 45 km/hr can cross in 30 sec is?
mcqs.explanation: Speed = 45 * 5/18 = 25/2 m/sec.Time = 30 secLet the length of bridge be x meters.Then, (130 + x)/30 = 25/2x = 245 m.

mcqs.question: A train 800 m long is running at a speed of 78 km/hr. If it crosses a tunnel in 1 min, then the length of the tunnel is?
mcqs.explanation: Speed = 78 * 5/18 = 65/3 m/sec.Time = 1 min = 60 sec.Let the length of the train be x meters.Then, (800 + x)/60 = 65/3x = 500 m.

mcqs.question: A goods train runs at the speed of 72 km/hr and crosses a 250 m long platform in 26 sec. What is the length of the goods train?
mcqs.explanation: Speed = 72 * 5/18 = 20 m/sec.Time = 26 sec.Let the length of the train be x meters.Then, (x + 250)/26 = 20x = 270 m.

mcqs.question: A train passes a station platform in 36 sec and a man standing on the platform in 20 sec. If the speed of the train is 54 km/hr. What is the length of the platform?
mcqs.explanation: Speed = 54 * 5/18 = 15 m/sec.Length of the train = 15 * 20 = 300 m.Let the length of the platform be x m . Then, (x + 300)/36 = 15 => x = 240 m.

mcqs.question: A 300 m long train crosses a platform in 39 sec while it crosses a signal pole in 18 sec. What is the length of the platform?
mcqs.explanation: Speed = 300/18 = 50/3 m/sec.Let the length of the platform be x meters.Then, (x + 300)/39 = 50/33x + 900 = 1950 => x = 350 m.

mcqs.question: A train speeds past a pole in 15 sec and a platform 100 m long in 25 sec, its length is?
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x m and its speed be y m/sec.Then, x/y = 15 => y = x/15(x + 100)/25 = x/15 => x = 150 m.

mcqs.question: A train moves fast a telegraph post and a bridge 264 m long in 8 sec and 20 sec respectively. What is the speed of the train?
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x m and its speed be y m/sec.Then, x/y = 8 => x = 8y(x + 264)/20 = yy = 22Speed = 22 m/sec = 22 * 18/5 = 79.2 km/hr.

mcqs.question: How many seconds will a 500 m long train take to cross a man walking with a speed of 3 km/hr in the direction of the moving train if the speed of the train is 63 km/hr?
mcqs.explanation: Speed of train relative to man = 63 - 3 = 60 km/hr.= 60 * 5/18 = 50/3 m/sec.Time taken to pass the man = 500 * 3/50 = 30 sec.

mcqs.question: A jogger running at 9 km/hr along side a railway track is 240 m ahead of the engine of a 120 m long train running at 45 km/hr in the same direction. In how much time will the train pass the jogger?
mcqs.explanation: Speed of train relative to jogger = 45 - 9 = 36 km/hr.= 36 * 5/18 = 10 m/sec.Distance to be covered = 240 + 120 = 360 m.Time taken = 360/10 = 36 sec.

mcqs.question: A train 110 m long is running with a speed of 60 km/hr. In what time will it pass a man who is running at 6 km/hr in the direction opposite to that in which the train is going?
mcqs.explanation: Speed of train relative to man = 60 + 6 = 66 km/hr.= 66 * 5/18 = 55/3 m/sec.Time taken to pass the men = 110 * 3/55 = 6 sec.

mcqs.question: Two trains 140 m and 160 m long run at the speed of 60 km/hr and 40 km/hr respectively in opposite directions on parallel tracks. The time which they take to cross each other is?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = 60 + 40 = 100 km/hr.= 100 * 5/18 = 250/9 m/sec.Distance covered in crossing each other = 140 + 160 = 300 m.Required time = 300 * 9/250 = 54/5  = 10.8 sec.

mcqs.question: Two trains are moving in opposite directions at 60 km/hr and 90 km/hr. Their lengths are 1.10 km and 0.9 km respectively. The time taken by the slower train to cross the faster train in seconds is?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = 60 + 90 = 150 km/hr.= 150 * 5/18 = 125/3 m/sec.Distance covered = 1.10 + 0.9 = 2 km = 2000 m.Required time = 2000 * 3/125 = 48 sec.

mcqs.question: A train 125 m long passes a man, running at 5 km/hr in the same direction in which the train is going, in 10 sec. The speed of the train is?
mcqs.explanation: Speed of the train relative to man = 125/10 = 25/2 m/sec.= 25/2 * 18/5 = 45 km/hrLet the speed of the train be x km/hr. Then, relative speed = (x - 5) km/hr.x - 5 = 45 => x = 50 km/hr.

mcqs.question: Two goods trains each 500 m long are running in opposite directions on parallel tracks. Their speeds are 45 km/hr and 30 km/hr respectively. Find the time taken by the slower train to pass the driver of the faster one?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = 45 + 30 = 75 km/hr.75 * 5/18 = 125/6 m/sec.Distance covered = 500 + 500 = 1000 m.Required time = 1000 * 6/125 = 48 sec.

mcqs.question: Two trains of equal are running on parallel lines in the same direction at 46 km/hr and 36 km/hr. The faster train passes the slower train in 36 sec. The length of each train is?
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of each train be x m. Then, distance covered = 2x m. Relative speed = 46 - 36 = 10 km/hr.= 10 * 5/18 = 25/9 m/sec.2x/36 = 25/9 => x = 50.

mcqs.question: A 270 m long train running at the speed of 120 km/hr crosses another train running in opposite direction at the speed of 80 km/hr in 9 sec. What is the length of the other train?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = 120 + 80 = 200 km/hr.= 200 * 5/18 = 500/9 m/sec.Let the length of the other train be x m.Then, (x + 270)/9 = 500/9 => x = 230.

mcqs.question: Two trains are running in opposite directions with the same speed. If the length of each train is 120 m and they cross each other in 12 sec, then the speed of each train is?
mcqs.explanation: Let the speed of each train be x m/sec.Then, relative speed of the two trains = 2x m/sec.So, 2x = (120 + 120)/12 => x = 10Speed of each train = 10 m/sec.= 10 * 18/5 =- 36 km/hr.

mcqs.question: Two trains of equal lengths take 10 sec and 15 sec respectively to cross a telegraph post. If the length of each train be 120 m, in what time will they cross other travelling in opposite direction?
mcqs.explanation: Speed of the first train = 120/10 = 12 m/sec.Speed of the second train = 120/5 = 8 m/sec.Relative speed = 12 + 8 = 20 m/sec.Required time = (120 + 120)/20 = 12 sec.

mcqs.question: Two trains are running at 40 km/hr and 20 km/hr respectively in the same direction. Fast train completely passes a man sitting in the slower train in 5 sec. What is the length of the fast train?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = (40 - 20) = 20 km/hr.= 20 * 5/ 18 = 50/9 m/sec.Length of faster train = 50/9 * 5 = 250/9 = 27 7/9 m.

mcqs.question: Two trains, each 100 m long, moving in opposite directions, cross other in 8 sec. If one is moving twice as fast the other, then the speed of the faster train is?
mcqs.explanation: Let the speed of the slower train be x m/sec.Then, speed of the train = 2x m/sec.Relative speed =  ( x + 2x) = 3x m/sec.(100 + 100)/8 = 3x => x = 25/3.So, speed of the faster train = 50/3 = 50/3 * 18/5 = 60 km/hr.

mcqs.question: Two trains, one from Howrah to Patna and the other from Patna to Howrah, start simultaneously. After they meet, the trains reach their destinations after 9 hours and 16 hours respectively. The ratio of their speeds is?
mcqs.explanation: Let us name the trains A and B.Then, (A's speed) : (B's speed)= √b : √a = √16 : √9 = 4:3

mcqs.question: A train moves with the speed of 180 km.hr then its speed in meters per second is:
A train 280 meters long is moving at speed of 60 km/hr. The time taken by the train to cross a platform 220 meters long is:
mcqs.explanation: Speed of the train = (60 Ã— 5/18) m/sec = (50/3) m/sec. Time taken by the   train           to   cross the platform =Time taken by it to cover (280+220)m =(500 Ã— 3/50) sec  = 30 sec.

mcqs.question: A train 50 meters long passes a platform 100 meters long in 10 seconds. The speed of the train is:
mcqs.explanation: Distance covered by train in 10 sec = (50+100)m = 150m         Speed = (150/10)m/sec = (15 Ã—18/5) km/hr = 54 km/hr

mcqs.question: A person sees a train passing over 1 km long bridge. The length of the train is half that of bridge if the train clears the bridge in 2 minutes the speed of the train is:
mcqs.explanation: Distance covered in 2/60 hr = (1+1/2) km = 3/2 km.         Distance covered in 1 hr = (3/2 Ã— 60/2) km = 45 km. Speed of the train = 45 km/hr

mcqs.question: A train 700 m long is running at the speed of 72km per hour if it crosses a tunnel in 1 minute. Then the length of the tunnel is:
mcqs.explanation: Speed = (72 Ã— 5/18 ) m/sec = 20 m/sec Length of tunnel = x meters (700+x)/60 = 20 => 700 + x = 1200 or x = 500 m

mcqs.question: A train 270 meters long is moving at a speed of 25 kmph. It will cross a man coming from the opposite direction at a speed of 2 km per hour in:
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = (25+2) km/hr = 27 km/hr = (27 x 5/18) m/sec = (15/2) m/sec. Time taken by the train to pass the man. = (270 Ã— 2/15) Sec = 36 Sec.

mcqs.question: A train 300 m long crossed a platform 900 m long in 1 minute 12 seconds. The speed of the train in km/hr was:
mcqs.explanation: Distance covered in 72 sec = (300+900)m Speed = (1200/72)m/sec =(50/3) m/sec = (50/3 Ã— 18/5) km/hr = 60 km/hr.

mcqs.question: A train crosses a platform 100 meters long in 60 seconds at a speed of 45 km per hour. The time taken by the train to cross an electric pole, is:
mcqs.explanation: Length of train = x meters Speed = (45 Ã— 5/18) m/sec = (25/2) m/sec Distance covered in crossing the platform = (x + 100) m  (x + 100) Ã— 2/25 = 60 or 2x + 200 = 1500 or x = 650 Time taken to cross the pale = (650 Ã— 2/25) Sec = 52 Sec.

mcqs.question: A train of length 150 meters takes 10 seconds to pass over another train 100 meters long coming from the opposite direction. If the speed of the first train be 30 kmph. The speed of the second train is:
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = (150+100â”‚10) m/sec  = 25 m/sec Speed of second train = (90-30) km/hr = 60 km/hr

mcqs.question: A  150-meter long train crosses a man walking at the speed of 6 kmph in the opposite direction in 6 seconds. The speed of the train in km/hr is:
mcqs.explanation: Speed of the train be x km/hr Relative speed = (x + 6) km/hr = [(x+6)Ã—5/18] m/sec = 150/6 = ((x+6)Ã—5)/18 or 5x + 30 = 450 or x = 84 km/hr

mcqs.question: A train speeds past a pale in 15 seconds and speeds past a platform 100 meters long in 25 seconds. Its length in meters is:
mcqs.explanation: length of the train be x meters and its speed be y meters/sec x/y = 15 => y = x/15 => (x+100)/25 = x/15 => x = 150 m

mcqs.question: A train 100 meters long moving at a speed of 50 kmph crosses a train 120 meters long coming from opposite direction in 6 seconds. The speed of second train is:
mcqs.explanation: Speed of the second train be x km/hr. Relative speed = (50 + x) km/hr = [(50 + x) Ã— 5/18] m/sec  = (250+5xâ”‚18) m/sec 220 Ã— 18 = 6 (250 + 5 x) The speed of the second train = 82 km/hr.

mcqs.question: Two stations A and B are 110 kms apart on a straight line. One train starts from A at 7 a.m and travels towards B at 20km per hour speed Another train starts from B at 8 a.m. and travels towards A at a speed of 25 Km per hour at what time will they meet?
mcqs.explanation: Suppose they meet x hrs after 7 a.m Distance covered by A in x hrs = (20 Ã— x) Distance covered by B in (x-1) hrs = 25 (x -1) km. So they meet at 10 a.m.

mcqs.question: A train running at certain speed crosses a stationary engine in 20 seconds. To find out the speed of the train. Which of the following information is necessary:
options: A) Only the length of the train
B) Only the length of the engine
C) Either the length of the train of the length of the engine
D) Both the length of the train and the length of the engine.
mcqs.explanation: Since the sum of the lengths of the train and the length of the engine is needed, So      both the lengths must be known.

mcqs.question: A 120m long train takes 10 seconds to cross a man standing on a platform. The speed of the train is
mcqs.explanation: Speed = (120/10) m/sec = 12 m/sec

mcqs.question: The speed of a train 150m long is 50kmph. How much time will it take to pass a platform 600m long?
mcqs.explanation: Speed =(50 x 5/18) m/sec = 125/9 m/sec Required Time =  54 sec

mcqs.question: How much time will a train 171m long take to cross a bridge 229m long, if it is running at a speed of 45kmph?
mcqs.explanation: Speed =  25/2 m/sec Required time =  32 sec

mcqs.question: A train travelling at a speed of 30m/sec crosses a platform 600m long in 30seconds. The length of the train is
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x m. Then it's Speed == 30 => 600 + x = 900 => x = 300m

mcqs.question: A 130m long train crosses a bridge in 30 seconds at 45kmph. The length of the bridge is
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the bridge be x metres. Speed of the train = But speed = (45 x 5/18) m/sec = 25/2 m/sec Therefore, => 130 + x = 375 => (375 -130) = 245m Hence, length of the bridge = 245m

mcqs.question: A train travelling at constant speed crosses a 96m long platform in 12 seconds and another 141m long platform in 15 seconds. The length of the train and it's speed are?
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x metres. =>=> 15x(96 +x) = 12 x (141 + x) => 3x = (1692 -1440) = 252 => X = 84m Speed of the train = 15 m/sec  = (15 x 18/5)kmph = 54kmph

mcqs.question: A train crosses a pole in 15 seconds while it crosses a 100m long platform in 25 seconds. The length of the train is
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x meters. Then x/15 =  => 25x = 1500 + 15x => 10x = 1500 => x =150. Hence the lengths of the trains is 150m

mcqs.question: Two trains 105m and 90m long run at the speeds of 45 kmph and 72 kmph respectively in opposite direction on parallel tracks. The time which they take to cross each other is
mcqs.explanation: Sum of the lengths of the trains = (105 + 90)m = 195m Relative speed = (72 +45)kmph = 117kmph               =(117 x 5/18)m/sec = 585/18 m/sec Required Time = (195 x 18/585)sec = 6 Sec

mcqs.question: A train passes two persons walking in the same direction in which the train is going. These persons are walking at the rate of 3km/hr and 5km/hr respectively and the train passes them completely in 10 seconds and 11 seconds respectively. The speed of the train is
mcqs.explanation: Let the length of the train be x km and it's speed be y km/hr Speed of the train relative to first man =(y-3)km/hr Speed of the train relative to second man = (y -5)km/hr => => Y-3 = 360x and 11y -55 =3600x => 10y -30 = 3600x and 11y -55 = 3600x => 10y -30 = 11y -55 => y = 25 Therefore, Speed of the train = 25km/hr.

mcqs.question: Two trains A and B start running together from the same point in the same direction at 60kmph and 72kmph respectively. If the length of each train is 240m. How long will it take for the train B to cross train A?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed =(72 -60)kmph = 12kmph = (12 x 5/18)m/sec = 10/3 m/sec Total distance covered =(240 +240)m =480m Required time =(480 x 3/10)sec = 144sec = 2min 24 sec.

mcqs.question: A train of length 150 metres takes 40.5 seconds to cross a tunnel of length 300 metres. What is the speed of the train in km/hr?
The length of a train and that of a platform are equal. If with a speed of 90 k/hr, the train crosses the platform in one minute, then the length of the train (in metres) is:
A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
A train of length 250 m runs at a speed of 70 km/hr. What will be the time taken to cross any stationary object standing at the railway station?
A train takes 10 sec to pass a signal post and covers a distance of 10 km in 15 min. Find the length of train?
A and B complete a work in 6 days. A alone can do it in 10 days. If both together can do the work in how many days?
A and B together can do a piece of work in 8 days. If A alone can do the same work in 12 days, then B alone can do the same work in?
A can do a piece of work in 4 days. B can do it in 5 days. With the assistance of C they completed the work in 2 days. Find in how many days can C alone do it?
A and B can do a piece of work in 6 2/3 days and 5 days respectively. They work together for 2 days and then A leaves. In how many days after that B will complete the work alone.
A can do a piece of work in 30 days. He works at it for 5 days and then B finishes it in 20 days. In what time can A and B together it?
A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days and 16 days respectively. Both work for 3 days and then A goes away. Find how long will B take to complete the remaining work?
A and B can do a piece of work in 3 days, B and C in 4 days, C and A in 6 days. How long will C take to do it?
A can do a piece of work in 10 days. He works at it for 4 days and then B finishes it in 9 days. In how many days can A and B together finish the work?
A work which could be finished in 9 days was finished 3 days earlier after 10 more men joined. The number of men employed was?
A and B can do a piece of work in 7 days. With the help of C they finish the work in 5 days. C alone can do that piece of work in?
Ravi can do a piece of work in 30 days while Prakash can do it in 40 days. In how many days will they finish it together?
Anil can do a work in 15 days while Sunil can do it in 25 days. How long will they take if both work together?
A can do a job in 18 days and B can do it in 30 days. A and B working together will finish twice the amount of work in ------- days?

A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days and C can do it 20 days. They started the work together and A leaves after 2 days and B leaves after 4 days from the beginning. How long will work lost?
A and B together can do a work in 6 days. If A alone can do it in 15 days. In how many days can B alone do it?
A, B and C can do a piece of work in 24, 30 and 40 days respectively. They start the work together but C leaves 4 days before the completion of the work. In how many days is the work done?
A is thrice as efficient as B and is, therefore, able to finish a piece of work 10 days earlier than B. In how many days A and B will finish it together?
mcqs.explanation: WC = 3:1WT = 1:3x                   3x1/x “ 1/3x = 1/10x = 20/33/20 + 1/20 = 1/5 => 5 days

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a piece of work in 7 days, 14 days and 28 days respectively. How long will they taken, if all the three work together?
After working for 6 days, Ashok finds that only 1/3 rd of the work has been done. He employs Ravi who is 60% as efficient as Ashok. How many days more would Ravi take to complete the work?
A is twice as good a work man as B and together they finish the work in 14 days. In how many days A alone can finish the work?
mcqs.explanation: WC = 2:12x + x = 1/14 => x = 1/422x = 1/21A can do the work in 21 days.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a work in 6, 8 and 12 days respectively doing the work together and get a payment of Rs.1800. What is B's share?
If A, B and C together can finish a piece of work in 4 days. A alone in 12 days and B in 18 days, then C alone can do it in?
5 men and 12 boys finish a piece of work in 4 days, 7 men and 6 boys do it in 5 days. The ratio between the efficiencies of a man and boy is?
9 men and 12 boys finish a job in 12 days, 12 men and 12 boys finish it in 10 days. 10 men and 10 boys shall finish it in how many days?
If 12 men do a work in 80 days, in how many days will 16 men do it?
A and B can finish a work in 16 days while A alone can do the same work in 24 days. In how many days B alone will complete the work?
Ramesh can finish a work in 20 days and Sushil in 25 days. They both work together for 5 days and then Sushil goes away. In how many days will Ramesh complete the remaining work?
16 men can complete a piece of work in 25 days. In how many days can 20 men complete that piece of work?
5 men are equal to as many women as are equal to 8 boys. All of them earn Rs.90 only. Men's wages are?
45 men working 8 hours per day dig 30 m deep. How many extra men should be put to dig to a depth of 50 m working 6 hours per day?
A is half good a work man as B and together they finish a job in 14 days. In how many days working alone B finish the job?
A and B can do a piece of work in 8 days. B and C can do it in 12 days and A and C in 16 days. Working together they will complete the work in how many days?
A can do a piece of work in 20 days. B in 15 days A and C in 12 days. In how many days can A finish the work if he is assisted by B on one day and C on the next, alternately?
3 men or 6 women can do a piece of work in 20 days. In how many days will 12 men and 8 women do the same work?
mcqs.explanation: 3M = 6W ---- 20 days12M + 8W -----?24W + 8 W = 32W ---?6W ---- 20                    32 -----? 6 * 20 = 32 * x => x = 15/4 days

mcqs.question: A is twice as good a workman as B and they took 7 days together to do the work B alone can do it in.
A can do half the work in one day where as B can do it full. B can also do half the work of C in one day. Ratio in their efficiency will be?
mcqs.explanation: WC of A: B = 1:2           B: C = 1:2        ---------------------          A: B: C = 1:2:4

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 12 days. He worked for 15 days and then B completed the remaining work in 10 days. Both of them together will finish it in.
A can do a half of certain work in 70 days and B one third of the same in 35 days. They together will do the whole work in.
If 3 workers collect 48 kg of cotton in 4 days, how many kg of cotton will 9 workers collect in 2 days?
A, B and C completed a piece of work, A worked for 6 days, B for 9 days and C for 4 days. Their daily wages were in the ratio of 3:4:5. Find the daily wages of C, if their total earning was Rs.1480?
mcqs.explanation: 3x                  4x           5x6                    9              418x + 36x + 20x = 148074x= 1480 => x= 205x= 100 Rs.

mcqs.question: Some persons can do a piece of work in 12 days. Two times the number of these people will do half of that work in?
If 12 men and 16 boys can do a piece of work in 5 days and 13 men together will 24 boys can do it in 4 days. Compare the daily work done by a man with that of a boy.
Two pipes X and Y can separately fill a cistern in 18 and 24 hours respectively. If they are turned on alternately for one hour each, how long will it take to fill the cistern?
mcqs.explanation: 1/18 + 1/24 = 7/7272/7= 10 2/77/72 * 10 = 35/36 ----- 20 hoursWR = 1 “ 35/36 = 1/361 h ----- 1/18? ----- 1/36 = 1/2 hours=> 20 1/2 hours

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 5 days and 10 days respectively. A starts the work and B joins him after 2 days. In how many days can they complete the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by A in 2 days = 2/5Remaining work = 3/5Work done by both A and B in one day = 1/5 + 1/10 = 3/10Remaining work = 3/5 * 10/3 = 2 days.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a work in 6 days, 8 days and 12 days respectively. In how many days can all three of them working together, complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by all three of them in one day = 1/6 + 1/8 + 1/12 = 3/8.The number of days required = 8/3 = 2 2/3 days.

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 12 days, B and C in 30 days and C and A in 36 days. In how many days will the work be completed, if all three of them work together?
mcqs.explanation: One day work of A and B = 1/12One day work of B and C = 1/30One day work of C and A = 1/362(A + B + C) = 1/12 + 1/30 + 1/362(A + B + C) = 13/90(A + B + C) = 13/180Number of days required = 180/13 days.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a piece of work in 24 days, 30 days and 40 days respectively. They began the work together but C left 4 days before the completion of the work. In how many days was the work completed?
mcqs.explanation: One day work of A, B and C = 1/24 + 1/30 + 1/40 = 1/10Work done by A and B together in the last 4 days = 4*(1/24 + 1/30) = 3/10Remaining work = 7/10The number of days required for this initial work = 7 days.The total number of days required = 4 + 7 = 11 days.

mcqs.question: P is three times as fast as Q and working together, they can complete a work in 12 days. In how many days can Q alone complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: P = 3QP + Q = 3Q + Q = 4QThese 4Q people can do the work in 12 days, which means Q can do the work in 48 days.Hence, P can do the work in 16 days.

mcqs.question: If 5 men and 2 boys working together, can do four times as much work per hour as a man and a boy together. Find the ratio of the work done by a man and that of a boy for a given time?
mcqs.explanation: 5M + 2B = 4(1M + 1B)5M + 2B = 4M + 4B1M = 2BThe required ratio of work done by a man and a boy = 2:1

mcqs.question: 30 men can do a work in 40 days. When should 20 men leave the work so that the entire work is completed in 40 days after they leave the work?
mcqs.explanation: Total work to be done = 30 * 40 = 1200Let 20 men leave the work after 'P' days, so that the remaining work is completed in 40 days after they leave the work.40P + (20 * 40) = 120040P = 400 => P = 10 days

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 4 hours and 12 hours respectively. A starts the work at 6AM and they work alternately for one hour each. When will the work be completed?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by A and B in the first two hours, working alternately = First hour A + Second hour B = 1/4 + 1/12 = 1/3.Total time required to complete the work = 2 * 3 = 6 days.

mcqs.question: A can do a work in 9 days and B can do the same work in 18 days. If they work together, in how many days will they complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: One day's work of A and B = 1/9 + 1/8 = (2+1)/18  = 1/6So, the time taken to complete the work is 6 days.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a work in 90, 30 and 45 days respectively. If they work together, in how many days will they complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: One days's work of A, B and C = 1/90 + 1/30 + 1/45= (1 + 3 + 2)/90 = 1/15A, B and C together can do the work in 15 days.

mcqs.question: P alone can complete a piece of work in 6 days. Work done by Q alone in one day is equal to one-third of the work done by P alone in one day. In how many days can the work be completed if P and Q work together?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by P alone in one day = 1/6th of the total work done by Q alone in one day = 1/3(of that done by P in one day) = 1/3(1/6 of the total) = 1/18 of the total.Work done by P and Q, working together in one day = 1/6 + 1/18  = 4/18 = 2/9 of the totalThey would take 9/2 days = 4 (1/2) days to complete the work working together.

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 18 day, B and C in 30 days, A and C in 22 (1/2) days. In how many days can A,B and C individually do the work?
mcqs.explanation: (A+B+C)'s two days work = 1/18 + 1/30 + 2/45= (5 + 3 + 4)/90 = 2/15(A+B+C)'s one day work = 2/15 * 1/2 = 1/15A's one day's work = 1/15 - 1/30 = 1/30B's one day's work = 1/15 - 2/45 = 1/45C's one day's work = 1/15 - 1/18= 1/90So, A,B and C can individually do the work in 30, 45 and 90 days.

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 21 days and B in 28 days. Together they started the work and B left after 4 days. In how many days can A alone do the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: Let A worked for x days. x/21 + 4/28 = 1 => x/21 = 6/7  => x = 18A worked for 18 days. So, A can complete the remaining work in 18 - 4 = 14 days.

mcqs.question: Varma can read a book in k minutes. What part of the book can he read in 8 minutes?(k>8)
mcqs.explanation: Part of the book he can read in 1 minute = 1/kPart of the book he can read in 8 minutes =8/k.

mcqs.question: Avinash is twice as fast as Bharat, and Bharat is one-third as fast as Chandra. If together they can complete a piece of work in 30 days, in how many days can Avinash, Bharat and Chandra do the work respectively?
mcqs.explanation: Let Chandra do the work in 2x days.Bharat can do it in 6x days and Avinash can do it in 3x days.1/(2x) +  1/(6x) + 1/(3x) = 1/30  =>  (3 + 1 +2)/6x  = 1/30 => x  = 30So, the time taken to complete the work by Avinash, Bharat, Chandra is 90, 180, 60 days respectively.

mcqs.question: A is twice as fast as B. If B alone can do a piece of work in 30 days, in what time can A and B together complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: A can do the work in 30/2 i.e., 15 days.A and B's one day's work = 1/15 + 1/30 = (2 + 1)/30 = 1/10So A and B together can do the work in 10 days.

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do the same work in 12 days. A and B worked together for 2 days. How many more days are required to complete the remaining work if they work together?
mcqs.explanation: A can do 1/10 of  the work in a day.B can do 1/12 of the work in a 1 day.Both of them together can do (1/10 + 1/12) part of work in 1 day  =  (6 + 5)/60 = 11/60They take 60/11 days to complete the work together.Given that they already worked for 2 days.The number of days required to complete remaining work => 60/11 - 2 = 38/11 = 3 (5/11) days.

mcqs.question: 50 men can complete a work in 65 days.Five days after started the work, 20 men left the group. In how many days can the remaining work be completed?
mcqs.explanation: After 5 days, the following situation prevails.50 men can complete the work in 60 days.30 men can  complete the work in ? days. M1 D1 = M2 D2 => 50 * 60 = 30 * D2 => D2 = (50 * 60)/30 = 100 days.

mcqs.question: Two persons A and B can complete a piece of work in 30 days and 45 days respectively. If they work together, what part of the work will be completed in 3 days?
mcqs.explanation: A's one day's work = 1/30 B's one day's work = 1/45 (A + B)'s one day's work = 1/30 + 1/45 = 1/18 The part of the work completed in 3 days = 3 (1/18) = 1/6.

mcqs.question: Twenty four men can do a work in 35 days. How many men are required to complete the work in 21 days?
mcqs.explanation: We have M1 D1 = M2 D2So, 24 * 35 = M2 * 21 => M2 = 40.

mcqs.question: A certain number of men can do a work in 65 days working 6 hours a day. If the number of men are decreased by one-fourth, then for how many hours per day should they work in order to complete the work in 40 days?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number of men initially be x.we have M1 D1 H1= M2 D2 H2 So, x * 65 * 6 = (3x)/4 * 40 * h2 => h2 = (65 * 6 * 4)/(3 * 40) = 13.

mcqs.question: Thirty men can do a work in 24 days. In how many days can 20 men can do the work, given that the time spent per day is increased by one-third of the previous time?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number of hours working per day initially be x.we have M1 D1 H1= M2 D2 H2 30 * 24 * x = 20 * d2 * (4x)/3  => d2 = (30 * 24 * 3)/(24 * 4) = 27 days.

mcqs.question: Sixty men can stitch 200 shirts in 30 days working 8 hours a day. In how many days can 45 men stitch 300 shirts working 6 hours a day?
If 12 men or 20 women can do a piece of work in 54 days, then in how many days can 9 men and 12 women together do the work?
mcqs.explanation: Given that 12m = 20w => 3m = 5w 9 men + 12 women = 15 women + 12 women = 27 women 20 women can do the work in 54 days. So, 27 women can do it in (20 * 54) /27 = 40 days.

mcqs.question: Five men and nine women can do a piece of work in 10 days. Six men and twelve women can do the same work in 8 days. In how many days can three men and three women do the work?
mcqs.explanation: (5m + 9w)10 = (6m + 12w)8 => 50m + 90w = 48w + 96 w => 2m = 6w => 1m = 3w5m + 9w = 5m + 3m = 8m 8 men can do the work in 10 days. 3m +3w = 3m + 1w = 4m So, 4 men can do the work in (10 * 8)/4 = 20 days.

mcqs.question: Two men can complete a piece of work in four days. Two women can complete the same work in eight days. Four boys can complete the same work in five days. If four men, eight women and 20 boys work together in how many days can the work be completed?
mcqs.explanation: Two men take four days to complete the workfour men would take (2 * 4)/4 = 2 days to complete it.Similarly four women would take two days to complete it and 20 children would take one day to complete it.All the three groups working togerther will complete 1/2 + 1/2 + 1/1 work in a day= 2 times the unit work in a day.They will take 1/2 a day to complete it working together.

mcqs.question: Twelve men and six women together can complete a piece of work in four days. The work done by a women in one day is half the work done by a man in one day. If 12 men and six women started working and after two days, six men left and six women joined, then in hoe many more days will the work be completed?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by a women in one day = 1/2 (work done by a man/day) One women's capacity = 1/2(one man's capacity) One man = 2 women. 12 men = 24 women. 12 men + 6 women = 30 women 30 women can complete the work in four days. In the first 2 days they can complete 1/2 of the work. Remaining part of the work = 1/2. If 6 men leave and 6 new women join, then new work force = 30 women - 12 women + 6 women = 24 women. Time taken by them to complete the remaining work = 1/2 (Time taken by 24 women to complete the work)= 1/2 * (30 * 4)/24 = 2 (1/2) days.

mcqs.question: Eight men, ten women and six boys together can complete a piece of work in eight days. In how many days can 20 women complete the same work if 20 men can complete it in 12 days?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number of units which can be completed by each man, each women and each boy be m/day, w/day and b/day respectively. Work = 8(8m + 10w +6b)units = 12(20m) 10w +6b = 22m b is unknown. We cannot find the relation between m and w. We cannot answer the question.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a work in 7 , 14 and 21 days respectively. They completed the work and got Rs.242. What is the share of C?
mcqs.explanation: The ratio of their working rates = 1/7 : 1/14 : 1/21 = 6 : 3 : 2. Since, they work together, the share of C  = 2/11 * 242 = Rs.44

mcqs.question: X men can do a work in 120 days. If there were 20 men less, the work would have taken 60 days more. What is the value of X?

Sreedhar and Sravan together can do a work in 25 days. With the help of Pavan, they completed the work in 8 days and earned Rs. 225. What is the share of Sravan, if Sreedhar alone can do the work in 75 days?
mcqs.explanation: Sravan's one day's work = 1/25 - 1/75 = 2/75Sravan worked for 8 days. So, his 8 days work = 8 * 2/75 = 16/75Sravan completed 16/75th of total work.So, his share is 16/75 * 225 = Rs. 48.

mcqs.question: Twelve men can complete a piece of work in 32 days. The same work can be completed by 16 women in 36 days and by 48 boys in 16 days. Find the time taken by one man, one woman and one boy working together to complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: 12 men take 32 days to complete the work.One man will take (12 * 32) days to complete it.Similarly one woman will take (16 * 36) days to complete it and one boy will take (48 * 16) days to complete it.One man, one woman and one boy working together will complete = 1/(12 * 32) + 1/(16 * 36) + 1/(48 * 16)= 1/(4 * 3 * 16 * 2) + 1/(16 * 4 * 9) + 1/(16 * 3 * 4 * 4) = 1/64(1/6 + 1/9 + 1/12) = 1/64 * 13/36 of the work in a day.They will take (64 * 36)/13 days to complete the work working together.

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 12 days and 36 days respectively. If they work on alternate days beginning with B, in how many days will the work be completed?
mcqs.explanation: The work done in the first two days = 1/12 + 1/36 = 1/9so, 9 such two days are required to finish the work.i.e., 18 days are required to finish the work.

mcqs.question: A does a work in 10 days and B does the same work in 15 days. In how many days they together will do the same work?
mcqs.explanation: A's 1 day work = 1/10; B's 1 day work = 1/15(A + B)'s 1 day work = (1/10 + 1/15) = 1/6So, both together will finish the work in 6 days.

mcqs.question: A man can do a job in 15 days. His father takes 20 days and his son finishes it in 25 days. How long will they take to complete the job if they all work together?
mcqs.explanation: 1 day work of the three persons = (1/15 + 1/20 + 1/25) = 47/300So, all three together will complete the work in 300/47 = 6.4 days.-

mcqs.question: A take twice as much time as B or thrice as much time to finish a piece of work. Working together, they can finish the work in 2 days. B can do the work alone in?
mcqs.explanation: Suppose A, B and C take x, x/2 and x/3 respectively to finish the work. Then, (1/x + 2/x + 3/x) = 1/2 6/x = 1/2 => x = 12 So, B takes 6 hours to finish the work.

mcqs.question: 10 women can complete a work in 7 days and 10 children take 14 days to complete the work. How many days will 5 women and 10 children take to complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: 1 women's 1 day work = 1/70 1 child's 1 day work = 1/140 (5 women + 10 children)'s 1 day work = (5/10 + 10/140) = (1/14 + 1/14) = 1/7 5 women and 10 children will complete the work in 7 days.

mcqs.question: If 12 men and 16 boys can do a piece of work in 5 days; 13 men and 24 boys can do it in 4 days, then the ratio of the daily work done by a man to that of a boy is?
mcqs.explanation: Let 1 man's 1 day work = x and 1 boy's 1 day work = y.Then, 12x + 16y = 1/5 and 13x + 24y = 1/4Solving these two equations, we get:x = 1/100 and y = 1/200Required ratio = x:y = 1/100 : 1/200 = 2:1.

mcqs.question: 4 men and 6 women can complete a work in 8 days, while 3 men and 7 women can complete it in 10 days. In how many days will 10 women complete it?
mcqs.explanation: Let 1 man's 1 day work = x and 1 woman's 1 day work = y.Then, 4x + 6y = 1/8 and 3x + 7y = 1/10Solving these two equations, we get:x = 11/400 and y = 1/4001 woman's 1 day work = (1/400 * 10) = 1/40.Hence, 10 women will complete the work in 40 days.

mcqs.question: If 6 men and 8 boys can do a piece of work in 10 days while 26 men and 48 boys can do the same in 2 days, the time taken by 15 men and 20 boys in doing the same type of work will be?
mcqs.explanation: Let 1 men's 1 day work = x and 1 boy's 1 day work = y.Then, 6x + 8y = 1/10 and 26x + 48y = 1/2Solving these two equations, we get:x = 1/100 and y = 1/200(15 men + 20 boys)'s 1 day work = (15/100 + 20/200) = 1/415 men and 20 boys can do the work in 4 days.

mcqs.question: 10 men and 15 women together can complete a work in 6 days. It takes 100 days for one man alone to complete the same work. How many days will be required for one woman alone to complete the same work?
mcqs.explanation: 1 man's 1 day work = 1/100(10 men + 15 women)'s 1 day work = 1/615 women's 1 day work = (1/6 - 10/100) = 1/151 woman's 1 day work = 1/225 1 woman alone can complete the work in 225 days.

mcqs.question: 12 men can complete a piece of work in 4 days, while 15 women can complete the same work in 4 days. 6 men start working on the job and after working for 2 days, all of them stopped working. How many women should be put on the job to complete the remaining work, if it so to be completed in 3 days?
mcqs.explanation: 1 man's 1 day work = 1/48; 1 woman's 1 day work = 1/60.6 men's 2 day's work = 6/48 * 2 = 1/4.Remaining work = (1 - 1/4) = 3/4Now, 1/60 work is done in 1 day by 1 woman.So, 3/4 work will be done in 3 days by (60 * 3/4 * 1/3) = 15 women.

mcqs.question: A man, a woman and a boy can complete a job in 3, 4 and 12 days respectively. How many boys must assist 1 man and 1 woman to complete the job in 1/4 of a day?
mcqs.explanation: (1 man + 1 woman)'s 1 day work = (1/3 + 1/4) = 7/12Work done by 1 man and 1 woman in 1/4 day = (7/12 * 1/4) = 7/48 Remaining work = (1 - 7/48) = 41/48Work done by 1 boy in 1/4 day = ( 1/12 * 1/4) = 1/48Number of boys required = 41/48 * 41 = 41.

mcqs.question: 3 men, 4 women and 6 children can complete a work in 7 days. A woman does double the work a man does and a child does half the work a man does. How many women alone can complete this work in 7 days?
mcqs.explanation: Let 1 woman's 1 day work = x.Then, 1 man's 1 day work = x/2 and 1 child's 1 day work x/4.So, (3x/2 + 4x + + 6x/4) = 1/728x/4 = 1/7 => x = 1/491 woman alone can complete the work in 49 days.So, to complete the work in 7 days, number of women required = 49/7 = 7.

mcqs.question: 12 men complete a work in 9 days. After they have worked for 6 days, 6 more men join them. How many days will they take to complete the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: 1 man's 1 day work = 1/108 12 men's 6 day's work = 1/9 * 6 = 2/3Remaining work = 1 - 2/3 = 1/318 men's 1 day work = 1/108 * 18 = 1/61/6 work is done by them in 1 day.1/3 work is done by them in 6 * 1/3 = 2 days.

mcqs.question: Kim can do a work in 3 days while David can do the same work in 2 days. Both of them finish the work together and get Rs. 150. What is the share of Kim?
mcqs.explanation: Kim's wages : David's wages = Kim's 1 day work : David's 1 day work = 1/3 : 1/2 = 2:3Kim's share = 2/5 * 150 = Rs. 60

mcqs.question: A alone can do a piece of work in 6 days and B alone in 8 days. A and B undertook to do it for Rs. 3200. With the help of C, they completed the work in 3 days. How much is to be paid to C?
A and B together can complete a work in 12 days. A alone can complete it in 20 days. If B does the work only for half a day daily, then in how many days A and B together will complete the work?
mcqs.explanation: B's 1 day work = (1/12 - 1/20) = 1/30Now, (A + B)'s 1 day work = (1/20 + 1/60) = 1/15So, A and B together will complete the work in 15 days.

mcqs.question: A, B and C can do a piece of work in 20, 30 and 60 days respectively. In how many days A do the work if he is assisted by B and C on every third day?
mcqs.explanation: A's 2 day's work = (1/20 * 2) = 1/10(A + B + C)'s 1 day work = (1/20 + 1/30 + 1/60) = 1/10Work done in 3 days = (1/10 + 1/10) = 1/5Now, 1/5 work is done in 3 days.Whole work will be done in (3 * 5) = 15 days.

mcqs.question: 20 women can do a work in 9 days. After they have worked for 6 days. 6 more men join them. How many days will they take to complete the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: (20 * 16) women can complete the work in 1 day.1 woman's 1 day work = 1/320(16 * 15) men can complete the work in 1 day1 man's 1 day work = 1/240So, required ratio = 1/240 : 1/320 = 4:3.

mcqs.question: Ronald and Elan are working on an assignment. Ronald takes 6 hrs to type 32 pages on a computer, while Elan takes 5 hrs to type 40 pages. How much time will they take, working together on two different computers to type an assignment of 110 pages?
mcqs.explanation: Number of pages typed by Ronald in 1 hour = 32/6 = 16/3 Number of pages typed by Elan in 1 hour = 40/5 = 8Number of pages typed by both in 1 hour = (16/3 + 8) = 40/3Time taken by both to type 110 pages = (110 * 3/40) = 8 1/4 = 8 hrs 15 min

mcqs.question: Sakshi can do a piece of work in 20 days. Tanya is 25% more efficient than Sakshi. The number of days taken by Tanya to do the same piece of work is?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of times taken by Sakshi and Tanys = 125:100 = 5:4Suppose Tanya takes x days to do the work.5:4 :: 20:x => x= 16 days.Hence, Tanya takes 16 days to complete the work.

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 4 hours; B and C together can do it in 3 hours, which A and C together can do it in 2 hours. How long will B alone take to do it?
mcqs.explanation: A's 1 hour work = 1/4;(B + C)'s 1 hour work = 1/3;(A + C)'s 1 hour work = 1/2(A + B + C)'s 1 hour work = (1/4 + 1/3) = 7/12B's 1 hour work = (7/12 + 1/2) = 1/12B alone will take 12 hours to do the work.

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 8 days, B and C can do the same work in 12 days. A, B and C together can finish it in 6 days. A and C together will do it in?
mcqs.explanation: (A + B + C)'s 1 day work = 1/6;(A + B)'s 1 day work = 1/8(B + C)'s 1 day work = 1/12(A + C)'s 1 day work = (2 * 1/6) - (1/8 + 1/12) = (1/3 - 5/24) = 1/8So, A and C together will do the work in 8 days.

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 12 days, B and C in 15 days, C and A in 20 days. If A, B and C work together, they will complete the work in?
mcqs.explanation: (A + B)'s 1 day work = 1/12;(B + C)'s 1 day work = 1/15;(A + C)'s 1 day work = 1/20Adding, we get: 2(A + B + C)'s 1 day work = (1/12 + 1/15 + 1/20) = 1/5(A + B + C)'s 1 day work = 1/10So, A, B and C together can complete the work in 10 days.

mcqs.question: A is 30% more efficient than B. How much time will they, working together, take to complete a job which A alone could have done in 23 days?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of times taken by A and B = 100:130 = 10:13Suppose B takes x days to do the work.x = (23 * 13)/10 = 299/10A's 1 day work = 1/23; B's 1 day work = 10/299(A + B)'s 1 day work = (1/23 + 10/299) = 1/13A and B together can complete the job in 13 days.

mcqs.question: A can finish a work in 18 days B can do the same work in 15 days. B worked for 10 days and left the job. In how many days, A alone can finish the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: B's 10 day's work = 1/15 * 10 = 2/3Remaining work = (1 - 2/3) = 1/3Now, 1/18 work is done by A in 1 day.1/3 work is done by A in (18 * 1/3) = 6 days.

mcqs.question: X and Y can do a piece of work in 20 days and 12 days respectively. X started the work alone and then after 4 days Y joined him till the completion of the work. How long did the work last?
mcqs.explanation: Work done by X in 4 days = (1/20 * 4) = 1/5Remaining work = (1 - 1/5) = 4/5(X + Y)'s 1 day work = (1/20 + 1/12) = 2/15Now, 2/15 work is done by X and Y in 1 day.So, 4/5 work will be done by X and Y in (15/2 * 4/5) = 6 days.Hence, total time taken = (6 + 4) = 10 days.

mcqs.question: A can do a price of work in 30days while B can do it in 40 days. In how many days can A and B working together do it?
mcqs.explanation: (A +B)'s 1 day's work = (1/30 + 1/40) = 7/120 Time is taken by both to finish the work = 120/7 days = 17 1/7 days.

mcqs.question: A and B can together do a price of work in 15 days. B alone can do it in 20 days. In how many days can A alone do it?
mcqs.explanation: A's 1 day's work = (1/15 “ 1/20) = 1/60 Therefore, A alone can finish = 60 days

mcqs.question: A can do (1/3) of a work in 5 days and B can do (2/5) of the work in 10 days. In how many days both A and B together can do the work?
mcqs.explanation: 1/3 of work is done by A in 5 days Therefore, whole work will be done by A in 15 days 2/5 of work is done by B in 10 days Whole work will be done by B in (10 x 5/2) i.e.., 25 days Therefore (A + B)'s 1 day's work = (1/15 + 1/25) = 8/75 So both together can finish 75/8 days i.e.., 9 3/8 days

mcqs.question: A, B and C contract a work for Rs. 550. Together A and B are to do 7/11 of the work. The share of C should be?
mcqs.explanation: Work to be done by C = (1 “ 7/11) = 4/11 Therefore, (A +B) = C = 7/11 : 4/11 = 7 : 4 Therefore C's share = Rs.(550 x 4/11) = Rs. 200

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 80 days. He works at it for 10 days and then B alone finishes the work in 42 days. The Two together could complete the work in?
mcqs.explanation: A's 10 days work = (10 x 1/80) = 1/8 Remaining work = (1 -1/8) = 7/8 Therefore 7/8 work is done by A in 42 days. Whole work will be done by A in (42 x 8/7)i.e.., 48 days Therefore, (A+ B)'s 1 day work = (1/80 + 1/48) = 8/240 = 1/30. A and B together can finish it in 30days.

mcqs.question: Mahesh and Umesh can complete a work in 10 days and 15 days respectively. Umesh starts the work and after 5 days Mahesh also joins him in all the work would be completed in
mcqs.explanation: Umesh's  5 day's work = 5 x 1/15 = 1/3 Remaining work = (1 “ 1/3) = 2/3(1/10 +1/ 15) work is done by both in 1 day Therefore 2/3 work is done by both in (6 x 2/3) = 4days. The work was completed in 9 days

mcqs.question: Twelve men can complete a work in 8 days. Three days after they started the work, 3 more men joined them. In how many days will all of them together complete remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: 1 man's one day's work = 1/96 12 men's 3 day's work = (3 x 1/8) = 3/8 Remaining work = (1 “ 3/8) = 5/8 15 men's 1 day's work = 15/96 Now 15/96 work is done by them in 1day Therefore 5/8 work will be done by them in (96/15 x 5/8) i.e., 4 days

mcqs.question: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do the same piece of work in 20 days. They start the work together but after 5 days. A leaves off B will do the remaining piece of work in?
mcqs.explanation: (A +B)'s 5 days work = 5 (1/10 +1/20) = ¾ Remaining work =(1 -3/4) = ¼ 1/20work is done by B in 1 day. Therefore, ¼ work is done by B in (20 x 1/4)i.e.., 5 days

mcqs.question: A and B can together finish a work in 30 days. They worked for it for 20 days and then B left. The remaining work was done by A alone in 20 more days. Alone can finish the work in?
mcqs.explanation: (A+ B)'s 20 day's work =(20 x 1/30) = 2/3 Remaining work = (1 -2/3) = 1/3 1/3 work is done by A in 20 days Whole work can be done by A in (3 x 20)days i.e.., 60 days

mcqs.question: A can complete a job in 9 days. B in 10 days and C in 15 days. B and C start the work and are forced to leave after 2 days. The time taken to complete the remaining work is?
mcqs.explanation: (B + C)'s 2 day's work = 2 (1/10 + 1/15) = 1/3Remaining work = (1 “ 1/3) = 2/31/9 work is done by A in 1 day Therefore 2/3 work is done by A in (9 x 2/3) = 6 days

mcqs.question: A, B and C together earn Rs.150 per day while A and C together earn Rs. 94 and B and C together earn Rs. 76. The daily earning of C is?
mcqs.explanation: B's daily earning = RS.(150 -94) = Rs. 56 A's daily earning = Rs.(150 -76) = Rs.74 C's daily earning = Rs.[150 “ (56+74)] = Rs. 20

mcqs.question: A can do a certain job in 12 days. B is 60% more efficient than A. Then Number of days it takes B to do the same piece of work is?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of times taken by A and B = 160 : 100 = 8 : 5 If A takes 8 days B takes  5 days If A takes 12 days, B takes =(5/8 x 12) = 7 ½ days

mcqs.question: A does half as much work as B in three “fourth of the time if together they take 18 days to complete a work. How much time shall B take to do it?
mcqs.explanation: B takes x days to do the work Therefore, A takes (2  Ã— 3/4x)i.e.., 3x/2 days to do it Now , (A +B)'s 1 day's work = 1/18 Therefore, 1/x + 2/3x = 1/18 or x =30.

mcqs.question: 12 Men or 18 women can reap a field in 14 days. The number of days that 8 men and 16 women will take to reap it?
mcqs.explanation: 12 men = 18 women or 1 man = 3/2 women Therefore 8 men + 16 women = (8 Ã— 3/2 + 16) women i.e.., 28 women Now 18 women can reap the field in 14 days Therefore, 28 women can reap it in        = 9 days

mcqs.question: If  3 men or 4 women can construct a wall in 43 days, then the number of days that 7 men and 5 women take to construct it is?
mcqs.explanation: 3 men = 4 women or 1 man = 4/3 women Therefore 7 men + 5 women = (7 Ã— 4/3 + 5)women i.e.., 43/3 women 4 women can construct the wall in 43 days Therefore, 43/3 women can construct it in = 12 days

mcqs.question: 10 men can finish a piece of work in 10 days. Whereas it takes 12 women to finish it in 10 days if 15 men and 6 women undertake to complete the work. How many days will they take to complete it?
mcqs.explanation: 10 men = 12 women or 1 man = 6/5 women Therefore 15 men + 6 women = (15 x 6/5 +6)women i.e,, 24 women Now 12 women can do the work in 10 days Therefore, 24 women can do it in    = 5 days

mcqs.question: 8 Children and 12 men complete a certain piece of work in 9 days. If each child takes twice the time taken by man to finish the work. In how many days will 12 men finish the same work?
mcqs.explanation: 2 children = 1 man Therefore (8 children +12 men) = 16 men Now less men more days12: 16 : : 9 : x Therefore, x  = (144/12) = 12 days

mcqs.question: A and B can do a work in 8 days, B and C can do the same work in 12 days. A, B and C together can finish it in 6 days. A and C together will do it in :
A can finish a work in 24 days, B in 9 days and C in 12 days. B and C start the work but are forced to leave after 3 days. The remaining work was done by A in:
X can do a piece of work in 40 days. He works at it for 8 days and then Y finished it in 16 days. How long will they together take to complete the work?
Raj can build a house alone in 16 days but Suraj alone can build it in 12 days. Raj and Suraj work on alternate days. If Raj works on first day, the house will be built in how many days?

A can complete a work in 12 days and B can complete in 8 days. A works for 8 hours every day while B works for 10 hours every day. If A and B together start working 8 hours per day, in how many days will they complete the work?
A, B and C invested Rs.6300, Rs.4200 and Rs.10500 respectively, in a partnership business. Find the share of A in profit of Rs.12100 after a year?
A, B, C and D enter into partnership. A subscribes 1/3 of the capital B 1/4, C 1/5 and D the rest. How much share did A get in a profit of Rs.2460?
If Rs.3250 be divided among Ram, Shyam and Mohan in the ratio of 1/2:1/3:1/4 then the share of each are?
options: A) Ram = Rs.1500, Shyam = Rs.1000, Mohan = Rs.750
B) Ram = Rs.2500, Shyam = Rs.500, Mohan = Rs.250
C) Ram = Rs.1200, Shyam = Rs.1300, Mohan = Rs.750

mcqs.question: If 6 (A's capital) = 8 (B's capital) = 10 (C's capital). Then the ratio of their capitals is:
mcqs.explanation: 6A = 8B = 10 CA:B:C = 1/6:1/8:1/10          =20:15:12

mcqs.question: A, B and C are partners in a business. Their capitals are respectively, Rs.5000, Rs.6000 and Rs.4000. A gets 30% of the total profit for managing the business. The remaining profit is divided among three in the ratio of their capitals. In the end of the year, the profit of A is Rs.200 more than the sum of the profits of B and C. Find the total profit.
A, B and C rents a pasture for Rs.870. A put in 12 horses for 8 months, B 16 horses for 9 months and 18 horses for 6 months. How much should C pay?

Two persons A and B take a field on rent. A puts on it 21 horses for 3 months and 15 cows for 2 months; B puts 15 cows for 6months and 40 sheep for 7 1/2 months. If one day, 3 horses eat as much as 5 cows and 6 cows as much as 10 sheep, what part of the rent should A pay?
mcqs.explanation: 3h = 5c6c = 10sA = 21h*3 + 15c*2    = 63h + 30c    = 105c + 30c = 135c B = 15c*6 + 40s*7 1/2     = 90c + 300s     = 90c + 180c = 270c A:B = 135:270            27:52 A = 27/79 = 1/3

mcqs.question: A, B and C are partners. A receives 2/3 of profits, B and C dividing the remainder equally. A's income is increased by Rs.200 when the rate to profit rises from 5 to 7 percent. Find the Capital of B?

mcqs.explanation: First persons investment = xSecond persons investment = x + 1000Third persons investments = x + 2000x + x + 1000 + x + 2000 = 90003x= 6000x = 2000Ratio = 2000 : 3000 : 4000             2:3:44/9* 54000 = 2400

mcqs.question: A and B rent a pasture for 10 months. A put in 80 cows for 7 months. How many can B put in for the remaining 3 months, if he pays half as much again as A?

A and B put in Rs.300 and Rs.400 respectively into a business. A reinvests into the business his share of the first year's profit of Rs.210 where as B does not. In what ratio should they divide the second year's profit?
A and B invests Rs.3000 and Rs.4000 respectively in a business. If A doubles his capital after 6 months. In what ratio should A and B divide that year's profit?
In a partnership between A, B and C. A's capital is Rs.5000. If his share of a profit of Rs.800 is Rs.200 and C's share is Rs.130, what is B's capital?

Krishan and Nandan jointly started a business. Krishan invested three times as Nandan did and invested his money for double time as compared to Nandan. Nandan earned Rs. 4000. If the gain is proportional to the money invested and the time for which the money is invested then the total gain was?
A and B start a business with Rs.6000 and Rs.8000 respectively. Hoe should they share their profits at the end of one year?
mcqs.explanation: They should share the profits in the ratio of their investments.The ratio of the investments made by A and B =6000 : 8000 => 3:4

mcqs.question: A and B starts a business with Rs.8000 each, and after 4 months, B withdraws half of his capital . How should they share the profits at the end of the 18 months?
mcqs.explanation: A invests Rs.8000 for 18 months, but B invests Rs.8000 for the first 4 months and then withdraws Rs.4000. So, the investment of B for remaining 14 months is Rs.4000 only.A                           :                           B8000*18         :   (8000*4) + (4000*14)14400               :    88000A:B = 18:11

mcqs.question: A and B invests Rs.10000 each, A investing for 8 months and B investing for all the 12 months in the year. If the total profit at the end of the year is Rs.25000, find their shares?
mcqs.explanation: The ratio of their profits A:B = 8:12 = 2:3Share of A in the total profit = 2/5 * 25000 = Rs.10000Share of A in the total profit = 3/5 * 25000 = Rs.15000

mcqs.question: A and B invests Rs.8000 and Rs.9000 in a business. After 4 months, A withdraws half of his capital and 2 months later, B withdraws one-third of his capital. In what ratio should they share the profits at the end of the year?
mcqs.explanation: A                     :                    B(8000*4)+(4000*8) :    (9000*6)+(6000*6)64000                                 :    9000032                                          :     45

mcqs.question: A and B start a business, with A investing the total capital of Rs.50000, on the condition that B pays A interest @ 10% per annum on his half of the capital. A is a working partner and receives Rs.1500 per month from the total profit and any profit remaining is equally shared by both of them. At the end of the year, it was found that the income of A is twice that of B. Find the total profit for the year?
mcqs.explanation: Interest received by A from B = 10% of half of Rs.50000 = 10% * 25000 = 2500.Amount received by A per annum for being a working partner = 1500 * 12 = Rs.18000.Let 'P' be the part of the remaining profit that A receives as his share.Total income of A = (2500 + 18000 + P)Total income of B = only his share from the remaining profit = 'P', as A and B share the remaining profit equally.Income of A = Twice the income of B(2500 + 18000 + P) = 2(P)P = 20500Total profit = 2P + 18000= 2*20500 + 18000 = 59000

mcqs.question: A, B and C started a business with capitals of Rs. 8000, Rs. 10000 and Rs. 12000 respectively. At the end of the year, the profit share of B is Rs. 1500. The difference between the profit shares of A and C is?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of investments of A, B and C is 8000 : 10000 : 12000 = 4 : 5 : 6And also given that, profit share of B is Rs. 1500=> 5 parts out of 15 parts is Rs. 1500Now, required difference is 6 - 4 = 2 partsRequired difference = 2/5 (1500) = Rs. 600

mcqs.question: A started a business with an investment of Rs. 70000 and after 6 months B joined him investing Rs. 120000. If the profit at the end of a year is Rs. 52000, then the share of B is?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of investments of A and B is (70000 * 12) : (120000 * 6) = 7 : 6Total profit = Rs. 52000Share of B = 6/13 (52000) = Rs. 24000

mcqs.question: Four car rental agencies A, B, C and D rented a plot for parking their cars during the night. A parked 15 cars for 12 days, B parked 12 cars for 20 days, C parked 18 cars for 18 days and D parked 16 cars for 15 days. If A paid Rs. 1125 as rent for parking his cars, what is the total rent paid by all the four agencies?
mcqs.explanation: The ratio in which the four agencies will be paying the rents = 15 * 12 : 12 * 20 : 18 * 18 : 16 * 15= 180 : 240 : 324 : 240 = 45 : 60 : 81 : 60Let us consider the four amounts to be 45k, 60k, 81k and 60k respectively.The total rent paid by the four agencies = 45k + 60k + 81k + 60k= 246kIt is given that A paid Rs. 112545k = 1125 => k = 25246k = 246(25) = Rs. 6150Thus the total rent paid by all the four agencies is Rs. 6150.

mcqs.question: P and Q started a business with respective investments of Rs. 4 lakhs and Rs. 10 lakhs. As P runs the business, his salary is Rs. 5000 per month. If they earned a profit of Rs. 2 lakhs at the end of the year, then find the ratio of their earnings?
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of investments of P and Q is 2 : 5 Total salary claimed by P = 12 * 5000 = Rs. 60000 Total profit = Rs. 2 lakhs. Profit is to be shared = Rs. 140000 Share of P = (2/7) * 140000 = Rs. 400000Share of Q = Rs. 100000Total earnings of P = (60000 + 40000) = Rs. 100000Ratio of their earnings = 1 : 1

mcqs.question: X and Y started a business with capitals Rs. 20000 and Rs. 25000. After few months Z joined them with a capital of Rs. 30000. If the share of Z in the annual profit of Rs. 50000 is Rs. 14000, then after how many months from the beginning did Z join?
mcqs.explanation: Investments of X, Y and Z respectively are Rs. 20000, Rs. 25000 and Rs. 30000Let investment period of Z be x months.Ratio of annual investments of X, Y and Z is (20000 * 12) : (25000 * 12) : (30000 * x)= 240 : 300 : 30x = 8 : 10 : xThe share of Z in the annual profit of Rs. 50000 is Rs. 14000.=> [x/ (18 + x)] 50000 = 14000 => [x/ (18 + x)] 25 = 7=> 25x = 7x + (18 * 7) => x = 7 months.Z joined the business after (12 - 7) months. i.e., 5 months.

mcqs.question: P and Q started a business investing Rs. 85,000 and Rs. 15,000 respectively. In what ratio the profit earned after 2 years be divided between P and Q respectively?
Anand and Deepak started a business investing Rs. 22,500 and Rs. 35,000 respectively. Out of a total profit of Rs. 13,800, Deepak's share is:
mcqs.explanation: Ratio of their shares = 22500 : 35000 = 9:14Deepak's share = 13800 * 14/23 = Rs. 8400.

mcqs.question: Divide Rs. 1500 among A, B and C so that A receives 1/3 as much as B and C together and B receives 2/3 as A and C together. A's share is?

mcqs.question: The average monthly salary of laborers and supervisors in a factory is Rs.1250 per month; where as the average monthly salary of 6 supervisors is Rs.2450. If the average monthly salary of the laborers is Rs.950 find the number of laborers?
In a bag there are coins of 50 paisa, 25 paisa and one rupee in the proportion 5:6:2. If there are in all Rs.42, the number of 25 paisa coins is?
mcqs.explanation: 5x              6x           2x50              25           100250x + 150x + 200x = 4200600x= 4200x = 7 => 6x = 42

mcqs.question: There are some pigeons and hares in a zoo. If heads are counted, there are 200. If legs are counted, there are 580. The number of hares in the zoo is?
mcqs.explanation: 200*2 = 400               580               -----               180 1----2 ?----180 = 90

mcqs.explanation: 5/6 * 3/2 * 4/5 = 1/1          1:1

mcqs.question: There is food for 760 men for 22 days. How many more men should join after two days so that the same food may last for 19 days more?
mcqs.explanation: 760 ---- 22 760 ---- 20    x ----- 19  x*19 = 760*20  x= 800        760       -------           40
