mcqs.question:
In each of the following numbers, what should be the missing digit in the indicated place such that the number is a multiple of 11?
945678_
mcqs.explanation: Divisibility of 11: If the difference of the sum of the digits at odd places and the sum of the digits at even places of a number is zero or a multiple of 11, then that number is divisible by 11.As per divisibility rule of 11, difference = (x + 21) - 18 = x + 3=> x + 3 = 11 => x = 8

mcqs.question: Find the number of factors of 300 excluding 1 and itself.
mcqs.explanation: 300 = 4.75 =  4.25.3 = 22.52.31 Number of factors of 300 = (2 + 1)(2 + 1)(1 + 1) = 18.There are 16 factors of 300 excluding 1 and itself.

mcqs.question: Find the smallest number which should be multiplied with 520 to make it a perfect square.
mcqs.explanation: 520 = 26 * 20 = 2 * 13 * 22 * 5 = 23 * 13 * 5Required smallest number = 2 * 13 * 5 = 130130 is the smallest number which should be multiplied with 520 to make it a perfect square.

mcqs.question: Find the least number with which 16200 should be multiplied, to make it a perfect cube.
mcqs.explanation: 16200 = 23 * 34 * 52 A perfect cube has a property of having the indices of all its prime factors divisible by 3.Required number = 32 * 5 = 45.

mcqs.question: If the L.C.M of two numbers is 750 and their product is 18750, find the H.C.F of the numbers.
mcqs.explanation: H.C.F = (Product of the numbers) / (Their L.C.M) = 18750/750 = 25.

mcqs.question: Find the smallest four-digit number which is a multiple of 112.
mcqs.explanation: The smallest four digit number is 1000. If 1000 is divided by 112, the remainder is 104.112 - 104 = 8, if 8 is added to 1000, it will become the smallest four digit number and a multiple of 112.

mcqs.question: A gardener wants to plant trees in his garden in such a way that the number of trees in each row should be the same. If there are 4 rows or 5 rows or 6 rows, then no tree will be left. Find the least number of trees required.
mcqs.explanation: The least number of trees that are required = LCM(4, 5, 6) = 60.

mcqs.question: Find the least number which when divided by 35 and 11 leaves a remainder of 1 in each case.
mcqs.explanation: The least number which when divided by different divisors leaving the same remainder in each case= LCM(different divisors) + remainder left in each case.Hence the required least number = LCM(35, 11) + 1 = 386.

mcqs.question: Find the smallest number which when divided by 13 and 16 leaves respective remainders of 2 and 5.
mcqs.explanation: Let 'N' is the smallest number which divided by 13 and 16 leaves respective remainders of 2 and 5.Required number = (LCM of 13 and 16) - (common difference of divisors and remainders) = (208) - (11) = 197.

mcqs.question: Find the greatest number which divides 83, 125 and 209 leaving the same remainder in each case.
mcqs.explanation: The greatest number which divides three dividends p, q and r leaving the same remainder in each case is given by H.C.F(any two of (q - p), (r - p) and (r - q)).For the given problem, p = 83, q = 125 and r = 209.Hence the greatest number which divides these three leaving the same remainder in each case is H.C.F(any two of (125 - 83, 209 - 83, 209 - 125) = 42.

mcqs.question: Two numbers have a H.C.F of 16 and a product of two numbers is 2560. Find the L.C.M of the two numbers?
mcqs.explanation: L.C.M of two numbers is given by(Product of the two numbers) / (H.C.F of the two numbers) = 2560/16 = 160.

mcqs.question: Find the greatest four digit number which leaves respective remainders of 2 and 5 when divided by 15 and 24.
mcqs.explanation: Since the difference between the divisors and the respective remainders is not constant, back substitution is the convenient method. None of the given numbers is satisfying the condition.

mcqs.question: Find the greatest number which leaves the same remainder when it divides 25, 57 and 105.
What is the remainder when 263251 is divided by 9?
mcqs.explanation: If the sum of the digits of a number is divisible by 9, the number will be divisible by 9. 2 + 6 + 3 + 2 + 5 + 1 = 19The nearest multiple of 9 is 18.19 - 18 = 1.

mcqs.question: The L.C.M of 2<sup>3</sup> * 3<sup>2</sup> * 5 and 3<sup>3</sup> * 5 <sup>2</sup> * 2<sup>3</sup> is.
What is the unit digit in 7<sup>105</sup> ?
mcqs.explanation: Unit digit in 7105 = unit digit in [(74)26 * 7] But, unit digit in (74)26 = 1 unit digit in 7105 = (1 * 7) = 7

mcqs.question:
How many of the following numbers are divisible by 132?
264, 396, 462, 792, 968, 2178, 5184, 6336
mcqs.explanation: 132 = 11 * 3 * 4Clearly, 968 is not divisible by 3None of 462 and 2178 is divisible by 4And, 5284 is not divisible by 11Each one of the remaining four numbers is divisible by each one of 4, 3 and 11.So, there are 4 such numbers.

mcqs.question: Which one of the following numbers is exactly divisible by 11?
mcqs.explanation: (4 + 5 + 2) - (1 + 6 + 3) = 1, not divisible by 11.(2 + 6 + 4) - (4 + 5 + 2) = 1, not divisible by 11.(4 + 6 + 1) - (2 + 5 + 3) = 1, not divisible by 11.(4 + 6 + 1) - (2 + 5 + 4) = 0. So, 415624 is divisible by 11.

mcqs.question: On dividing a number by 68, we get 269 as quotient and 0 as remainder. On dividing the same number by 67, what will be the remainder?
mcqs.explanation: Number = 269 * 68 + 0 = 1829267) 18292 (273       18291         --------                1Required number = 1.

mcqs.question: On dividing number by 56, we get 29 as remainder. On dividing the same number by 8, what will be the remainder?
mcqs.explanation: Let x be the number and y be the quotient. Then, x = 357 * y + 39= (17 * 21 * y) + (17 * 2) + 5= 17 * (21y + 2) + 5.Required remainder = 5.

mcqs.question: On dividing number by 357, we get 39 as remainder. On dividing the same number by 17, what will be the remainder?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x and on dividing x by 5, we get k as quotient and 3 as remainder.x = 5k + 3x2 = (5k + 3)2 = (25k2 + 30k + 9) = 5(5k2 + 6k + 1) + 4 On dividing x2 by 5, we get 4 as remainder.

mcqs.question: On dividing number by 5, we get 3 as remainder. What will be the remainder when the square of this number is divided by 5?
The difference of two numbers is 1365. On dividing the larger number by the smaller, we get 6 as quotient and 15 as remainder. What is the smaller number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the smallest number be x.Then larger number = (x + 1365)x + 1365 = 6x + 15= 5x = 1350 x = 270Smaller number = 270.

mcqs.question: In a division sum, the remainder is 0. As student mistook the divisor by 12 instead of 21 and obtained 35 as quotient. What is the correct quotient?
mcqs.explanation: Number = (12 * 35) = 420Correct quotient = 420/21 = 20

mcqs.question: The sum of the two numbers is 12 and their product is 35. What is the sum of the reciprocals of these numbers?
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be a and b. Then,a + b = 12 and ab = 35.(a + b)/ab = 12/35= (1/b + 1/a) = 12/35Sum of reciprocals of given numbers = 12/35.

mcqs.question: The difference between a positive proper fraction and its reciprocal is 9/20. The fraction is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the required fraction be x. Then, 1/x - x = 9/20 20x2 + 9x - 20 = 0 20x2 + 25x - 16x - 20 = 0 5x(4x + 5) -4(4x + 5) = 0(4x + 5)(5x - 4) = 0x = 4/5

mcqs.question: On dividing 2272 as well as 875 by 3-digit number N, we get the same remainder. The sum of the digits of N is:
mcqs.explanation: Clearly, (2272 - 875) = 1397, is exactly divisible by N.Now. 1397 = 11 * 127The required 3-digit number is 127, the sum of whose digit is 10.

mcqs.question: On multiplying a number by 7, the product is a number each of whose digits is 3. The smallest such number is:
mcqs.explanation: By hit and trail, we find that47619 * 7 = 333333.7) 333333 (47619     333333----------------        0

mcqs.question: The difference between a number and its three-fifth is 50. What is the number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,x - 3/5 x = 50 => 2/5 x = 50x = (50 * 5)/2 = 125.

mcqs.question: If one-third of one fourth of a number is 15, then three-tenth of that number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,1/3 of 1/4 of x = 15x = 15 * 12 = 180So, required number = (3/10 * 180) = 54.

mcqs.question: A number is doubled and 9 is added. If the resultant is trebled, it becomes 75. What is that number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,3(2x + 9) = 752x = 16 => x = 8

mcqs.question: Find the number which multiplied by 15 is increased by 196.
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,15x - x = 196x = 14

mcqs.question: If the sum of one-half of a number exceeds one-third of that number by 7 1/3, the number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,(1/2 x + 1/5 x) - 1/3 x = 22/311/30 x = 22/3x = 20

mcqs.question: If the sum of a number and its square is 182, what is the number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,x + x2 = 182 (x + 14)(x - 13) = 0x = 13

mcqs.question: Twenty times a positive integer is less than its square by 96. What is the integer?
mcqs.explanation: Let the integer be x. Then, x2 - 20x = 96 (x + 4)(x - 24) = 0 x = 24

mcqs.question: Thrice the square of a natural number decreased by 4 times the number is equal to 50 more than the number. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then, 3x2 - 4x = x + 50 3x2 - 5x - 50 = 0 (3x + 10)(x - 5) = 0 x = 5

mcqs.question: The sum of a number and its reciprocal is one-eighth of 34. What is the product of the number and its square root?
mcqs.explanation: Let the number be x. Then,x + 1/x = 34/8 8x2 - 34x + 8 = 0 4x2 - 17x + 4 = 0 (4x - 1)(x - 4) = 0 x = 4required number = 4 * √4 = 4 * 2 = 8.

mcqs.question: Two-third of a positive number and 25/216 of its reciprocal are equal. The number is:
The product of two natural numbers is 17. Then, the sum of the reciprocals of their squares is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be a and b. Then,ab = 17, a = 1 and b = 17So, 1/a2 + 1/b2 = (a2 + b2)/a2 b2 = (12 + 172)/(1 * 17)2 = 290/289

mcqs.question: The sum of the numbers is 264. If the first number be twice the second and third number be one-third of the first, then the second number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the second number be x. Then, first number = 2x and third number = 2x/3.2x + x + 2x/3 = 26411x/3 = 264x = 72

mcqs.question: The sum of two numbers is 22. Five times one number is equal to 6 times the other. The bigger of the two numbers is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be x and (22 - x). Then,5x = 6(22 - x) 11x = 132 => x = 12So, the numbers are 12 and 10.

mcqs.question: The sum of two numbers is 25 and their difference is 13. Find their product.
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y. Then x + y = 25 and x - y = 13.x = 19; y = 6xy = 19 * 6 = 114

mcqs.question: The difference between two integers is 5. Their product is 500. Find the numbers.
mcqs.explanation: Let the integers be x and (x + 5). Then, x(x + 5) = 500 x2 + 5x - 500 = 0 (x + 25)(x - 20) = 0 x = 20So, the numbers are 20 and 25.

mcqs.question: If the sum and difference of two numbers are 20 and 8 respectively, then the difference of their square is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y. Then, x + y = 20 and x - y = 8x2 - y2 = (x + y)(x - y) = 20 * 8 = 160.

mcqs.question: If the sum of the two numbers is 22 and the sum of their squares is 404, then the product of the numbers is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y. Then, (x + y) = 22 and x2 + y2 = 404 Now, 2xy = (x + y)2 - (x2 + y2) 2xy= 222 - 404 = 484 - 404 = 80xy = 40

mcqs.question: The sum of three consecutive numbers is 87. The greatest among these three number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be x, x + 1 and x + 2 Then, x + (x + 1) + (x + 2) = 873x = 84x = 28Greatest number, (x + 2) = 30.

mcqs.question: Three times the first of three consecutive odd integers is 3 more than twice the third. The third integer is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the three integers be x, x + 2 and x+ 4.Then,3x = 2(x + 4) + 3x = 11Third integer = x + 4 = 15.

mcqs.question: The sum of three consecutive multiples of 3 is 72. What is the largest number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be 3x, 3x + 3 and 3x + 6.Then,3x + (3x + 3) + (3x + 6) = 729x = 63x = 7Largest number = 3x + 6 = 27.

mcqs.question: The sum of the digits of a two-digit number is 15 and the difference between the digits is 3. What is the two-digit number?
mcqs.explanation: Let the ten's digit be x and unit's digit by yThen, x + y = 15 and x - y = 3 or y - x = 3Solving x + y = 15 and x - y = 3, we get: x = 9, y = 6Solving x + y = 15 and y - x = 3, we get: x = 6, y = 9So, the number is either 96 or 69.Hence, the number cannot be determined.

mcqs.question: In a two-digit number, if it is known that its unit's digit exceeds its ten's digit by 2 and that the product of the given number and the sum of its digits is equal to 144, then the number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the ten's digit be x. Then, unit's digit = x + 2.Number = 10x + (x + 2) = 11x + 2 Sum of digits = x + (x + 2) = 2x + 2 (11x + 2)(2x + 2) = 144 2x2 + 26x - 140 = 0 (x - 2)(11x + 35) = 0 x = 2Hence, required number = 11x + 2 = 24.

mcqs.question: A number consists of two digits. If the digits interchange places and the new number is added to the original number, then the resulting number will be divisible by:
mcqs.explanation: Let the ten's digit be x and unit's digit be y. Then, number 10x + y.Number obtained by interchanging the digits = 10y + x.(10x + y) + (10y + x) = 11(x + y)which is divisible by 11.

mcqs.question: The difference between a two-digit number and the number obtained by interchanging the two digits is 63. Which is the smaller of the two numbers?
mcqs.explanation: Let the ten's digit be x and units digit by y.Then,(10x + y) - (10y + x) = 639(x - y) = 63x - y = 7Thus, none of the numbers can be determined.

mcqs.question: The difference between a two-digit number and the number obtained by interchanging the digit is 36. What is the difference between the sum and the difference of the digits of the number if the ratio between the digits of the number is 1:2?
mcqs.explanation: Since the number is greater than the number obtained on reversing the digits, so the ten's digit is greater than the unit's digit.Let the ten's and unit's digits be 2x and x respectively.Then, (10 * 2x + x) - (10x + 2x) = 369x = 36x = 4Required difference = (2x + x) - (2x - x) = 2x = 8.

mcqs.question: A number consists of 3 digit whose sum is 10. The middle digit is equal to the sum of the other two and the number will be increased by 99 if its digits are reversed. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the middle digit be x. Then, 2x = 10 or x = 5.So, the number is either 253 or 352. Since the number increases on reversing the digits, so the hundred's digit is smaller than the unit's digit. Hence, required number = 253.

mcqs.question: A two-digit number is such that the product of the digits is 8. When 18 is added to the number, then the digits are reversed. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the ten's and unit's digit be x and 8/x respectively. Then, (10x + 8/x) + 18 = 10 * 8/x + x 9x2 + 18x - 72 = 0 x2 + 2x - 8 = 0 (x + 4)(x - 2) = 0 x = 2 So, ten's digit = 2 and unit's digit = 4. Hence, required number = 24.

mcqs.question: In a pair of fractions, fraction A is twice the fraction B and the product of two fractions is 2/25. What is the value of fraction A?
The sum of the squares of three numbers is 138, while the sum of their products taken two at a time is 131. Their sum is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the numbers be a, b and C. Then, a2 + b2 + c2 = 138 and (ab + bc + ca) = 131 (a + b + c)2 = a2 + b2 + c2 + 2(ab + bc + ca) 138 + 2 * 131 = 400 (a + b + c) = √400 = 20

mcqs.question: The sum of two numbers is 100 and their difference is 37. The difference of their squares is:
mcqs.explanation: The number be a and b. =>a + b = 100 and =>a “ b = 37 => a2 “ b2 = (a + b) (a - b) = 100 Ã— 37 = 3700

mcqs.question: The ratio between two numbers is 3:4 and their sum is 420. The greater of the two numbers is:
mcqs.explanation: The numbers be 3x and 4x => 3x + 4x = 420 => 7x = 420 => x = 60 Greater number = 4 Ã— 60 = 240

mcqs.question: The difference between the squares of two consecutive numbers is 35 The numbers are:
mcqs.explanation: The number be x and (x + 1) => (x+1) 2 “ x2 = 35 => x2 + 2x +1-x2 = 35  => 2x = 34 or x = 17.

mcqs.question: Three fourth of one “ fifth of a number is 60. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => 3/4  Ã— 1/5 Ã— x = 60 => 3x = 1200 or x = 400

mcqs.question: A number is 25 more than its two “ fifth. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: The number be x. then. => X “ 25 = 2/5 x or 5x “ 125 = 2x or x =125/3

mcqs.question: 24 is divided into two parts such that 7 times the first part added to 5 times the second part makes 146. The first part is:
mcqs.explanation: Parts be x and 24 “ x => 7x + 5 (24 - x) = 146 => 7x + 120 “ 5x = 146  => 2x = 26 or x = 13

mcqs.question: If one “ fifth of a number decreased by 5 is 5 than a number is:
11 times a number gives 132. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => 11x = 123 => x = 12

mcqs.question: 4/5 of a certain number is 64. Half of that number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => 4/5 x = 64 => x = 320/4= 80 Half of the number = 40

mcqs.question: A positive number when decreased by 4, is equal to 21 times the reciprocal of the number. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x.  X “ 4 = 21/x => x2 “ 4x “ 21 = 0  => x2 “ 7x + 3x “ 21 = 0  => x (x - 7) + 3 (x - 7) = 0  => (x - 7) (x + 3) = 0  => x = 7 (neglecting x = - 3)

mcqs.question: The sum of two numbers is twice their difference. If one of the numbers is 10, the other number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. =>10 + x = 2 (x - 10) => x = 30

mcqs.question: The sum of squares of two numbers is 80 and the square of their difference is 36. The product of the two numbers is:
mcqs.explanation: Numbers be a and b. => a2 + b2 =  80 and (a - b) 2 = 36 => (a - b) 2 = 36 => a2 + b2 “ 2ab = 36  => 2ab = (a2 + b2) “ 36 = 80 “ 36 = 44  => ab = 22.

mcqs.question: The product of two numbers is 120. The sum of their squares is 289 The sum of the two numbers is:
mcqs.explanation: Numbers be a and b. => (a + b) 2 = (a2 + b2) + 2ab = 289+2 Ã— 120 = 289 + 240  = 529 => a+b = √529 = 23

mcqs.question: 4/5 of a number exceeds its 2/3 by 8. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => 4/5 x “ 2/3 x = 8 => (12x-10 x)/15 = 8 => 2x = 120 or x = 60

mcqs.question: If 1 is added to the denominator of a fraction. The fraction becomes 1/2. If 1 is added to the numerator. The fraction becomes 1. The fraction is:
mcqs.explanation: Required fraction be x/y x/y+1 = 1/2 => 2x “ y = 1 and (x+1)/y = 1 => x “ y = -1= 2x “ y = 1 & x “ y = -1, we get x = 2, y = 3. The fraction is 2/3.

mcqs.question: A fraction becomes 4 when 1 is added to both the numerator and denominator and it becomes 7 when 1 is subtracted from both the numerator and denominator. The numerator of the given fraction is:
mcqs.explanation: required fraction be x/y => (x+1)/(y+1) = 4 => x “ 4y = 3 (x- 1)/(y- 1) = 7 => x “ 7 y = -6  X = 15, y = 3

mcqs.question: Three numbers are in the ratio 3:4:5 The sum of the largest and the smallest equals the sum of the third and 52. The smallest number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be 3x. 4x and 5x. => 5x+3x = 4x+52 => 4x = 52 => x = 13 The smallest number = 3x = 3 Ã— 13 = 39

mcqs.question: The sum of three numbers is 68. If the ratio between first and second be 2:3 and that between second and third be 5:3 then the second number is:
mcqs.explanation: Numbers be a, b, c => a/b = 2/3, b/c = 5/3 => a/b = 10/15 and b/c = 15/9 => a:b:c = 10:15:9 Numbers be 10x, 15x and 9x. => 10x + 15x + 9x = 68 => 34 x = 68 => x = 2 Second number = 15 x = 15 Ã— 2 = 30

mcqs.question: A number exceeds 20 % of itself by 40. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => X “ (20/100) x = 40 or 5 x “ x = 200 or x = 50

mcqs.question: If 16 % of 40 % of a number is 8, the number is:
Of the three numbers, the first is twice the second and is half of the third. If the average of three numbers is 56. The smallest number is:
mcqs.explanation: Second number be x. First number = 2x Third number = 4x  (2x Ã—x+4x)/3 = 56 => 7x = 3 Ã— 56 or x = (3 Ã—56)/7 = 24

mcqs.question: Two numbers are such that the ratio between them is 3:5 but if each is increased by 10, the ratio between them becomes 5:7. The numbers are:
mcqs.explanation: Numbers be 3x and 5x. => (3x+10)/(5x+10) = 5/7 => 7 (3 x + 10) = 5(5x + 10) => x = 5 Numbers are 15 and 25.

mcqs.question: Divide 50 into two parts so that the sum of their reciprocals is (1/12):

mcqs.question: The sum of seven numbers is 235. The average of the first three is 23 and that of the last three is 42. The fourth number is:
mcqs.explanation: (23 Ã— 3 + x + 42 Ã— 3) =235 => x = 40 Fourth number = 40

mcqs.question: A number when divided by 6 is diminished by 40. The number is:
mcqs.explanation: Number be x. => x/6 + 40 = x => x + 240 = 6x => x = 48

mcqs.question: A sum of Rs.4800 is invested at a compound interest for three years, the rate of interest being 10% p.a., 20% p.a. and 25% p.a. for the 1st, 2nd and the 3rd years respectively. Find the interest received at the end of the three years.
mcqs.explanation: Let A be the amount received at the end of the three years. A = 4800[1 + 10/100][1 + 20/100][1 + 25/100] A = (4800 * 11 * 6 * 5)/(10 * 5 * 4) A = Rs.7920 So the interest = 7920 - 4800 = Rs.3120

mcqs.question: What is the difference between the compound interest on Rs.12000 at 20% p.a. for one year when compounded yearly and half yearly?
mcqs.explanation: When compounded annually, interest = 12000[1 + 20/100]1 - 12000 = Rs.2400 When compounded semi-annually, interest = 12000[1 + 10/100]2 - 12000 = Rs.2520 Required difference = 2520 - 2400 = Rs.120

mcqs.explanation: Amount of money Siddharth borrowed at S.I at 6% p.a. for two years = Rs.6,000 He lend the same amount for C.I at 6% p.a. for two years. => Siddharth's income = C.I - S.I = p[1 + r/ 100]n - p - pnr/100 = p{ [1 + r/ 100]2 - 1 - nr/100 = 6,000{ [1 + 6/100]2 - 1 - 12/100} = 6,000 {(1.06)2- 1 - 0.12} = 6,000(1.1236 - 1 - 0.12) = 6,000 (0.0036) = 6 * 3.6 = Rs.21.60

mcqs.question: A person bought an article and sold it at a loss of 10%. If he had bought it for 20% less and sold it for Rs.75 less, he could have gained 25%. What is the cost price?
mcqs.explanation: CP1 = 100             SP1= 90CP2 = 80                SP2 = 80 * (140/100)= 11222 ----- 10055 ----- ? => Rs.250

mcqs.question: If goods be purchased for Rs.840 and one-fourth be sold at a loss of 20% at what gain percent should the remainder be sold so as to gain 20% on the whole transaction?
mcqs.explanation: 1/4 CP = 210                       SP= 21*(80/100) = 168SP = 840*(120/100) = 10081008 - 168 = 8403/4 SP = 630Gain = 210630 --- 210100 --- ? =>33 1/3%

mcqs.question: Oranges are bought at 11 for a rupee and an equal number more at 9 a rupee. If these are sold at 10 for a rupee, find the loss or gain percent?
A dealer purchased an article at 3/4 of its list price and sold 50% more than the list price. Find his gain percent?
A trader marked the price of a car 20% above the cost price and allowed the purchaser 5% discount on the marked price there by gained Rs.8400. Find the cost price of the car?
A trader marked the price of the T.V. 30% above the cost price of the T.V. and gave the purchaser 10% discount on the marked price, thereby gaining Rs.340. Find the cost price of the T.V?
A person buys an article at Rs.500. At what price should he sell the article so as to make a profit of 20%?
mcqs.explanation: Cost price = Rs.500profit = 20% of 500 = Rs.100Selling price = Cost price + Profit= 500 + 100 = 600

mcqs.question: By selling an article at Rs.600, a profit of 25% is made. Find its cost price?
By selling an article at Rs.800, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 25%. At what price should he sell the article so as to make a loss of 25%?
A shopkeeper buys two articles for Rs.1000 each and then sells them, making 20% profit on the first article and 20% loss on second article. Find the net profit or loss percent?
mcqs.explanation: Profit on first article = 20% of 1000 = 200.This is equal to the loss he makes on the second article. That, is he makes neither profit nor loss.

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper sells two articles at Rs.1000 each, making a profit of 20% on the first article and a loss of 20% on the second article. Find the net profit or loss that he makes?
mcqs.explanation: SP of first article = 1000Profit = 20%CP = (SP)*[100/(100+P)] = 5000/6 = 2500/3SP of second article = 1000Loss = 20%CP = (SP)*[100/(100-L)] = 5000/4 = 1250Total SP = 2000Total CP = 2500/3 + 1250 = 6250/3CP is more than SP, he makes a loss.Loss = CP-SP = (6250/3)- 2000 = 250/3Loss Percent = [(250/3)/(6250/3)]*100 =0.04 * 100 = 4%

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper buys mangoes at the rate of 4 a rupee and sells them at 3 a rupee. Find his net profit or loss percent?
mcqs.explanation: The total number of mangoes bought by the shopkeeper be 12.If he buys 4 a rupee, his CP = 3He selling at 3 a rupee, his SP = 4Profit = SP - CP = 4 - 3 = 1Profit Percent = 1/3 * 100 = 33 1/3 %

mcqs.question: A dishonest dealer professes to sell his goods at Cost Price but still gets 20% profit by using a false weight. What weight does he substitute for a kilogram?
mcqs.explanation: If the cost price is Rs.100, then to get a profit of 20%, the selling price should be Rs.120.If 120kg are to be sold, and the dealer gives only 100kg, to get a profit of 20%.How many grams he has to give instead of one kilogram(1000 gm).120 gm ------ 100 gm1000 gm ------ ?(1000 * 100)/120 = 2500/3 = 833 1/3 grams.

mcqs.question: The owner of a furniture shop charges his customer 24% more than the cost price. If a customer paid Rs. 8339 for a computer table, then what was the cost price of the computer table?
A person purchased a TV set for Rs. 16000 and a DVD player for Rs. 6250. He sold both the items together for Rs. 31150. What percentage of profit did he make?
Ramu bought an old car for Rs. 42000. He spent Rs. 13000 on repairs and sold it for Rs. 64900. What is his profit percent?
A trader sells 85 meters of cloth for Rs. 8925 at the profit of Rs. 15 per metre of cloth. What is the cost price of one metre of cloth?
mcqs.explanation: SP of 1m of cloth = 8925/85 = Rs. 105 CP of 1m of cloth = SP of 1m of cloth - profit on 1m of cloth = Rs. 105 - Rs. 15 = Rs. 90.

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper loses 15%,if an article is sold for Rs. 102. What should be the selling price of the article to gain 20%?
If an article is sold at 19% profit instead of 12% profit, then the profit would be Rs. 105 more. What is the cost price?
mcqs.explanation: Let the cost price of an article be Rs. x.(19% of x) - (12% of x) = 10519x/100 - 12x/100 = 105 => 7x = 105 * 100=> x = 1500Cost price = Rs. 1500

mcqs.question: Raman mixed 24 kg of butter at Rs. 150 per kg with 36 kg butter at the rate of Rs. 125 per kg. At what price per kg should he sell the mixture to make a profit of 40% in the transaction?

Vijay bought 160 shirts at the rate of Rs. 225 per shirt. The transport expenditure was Rs. 1400. He paid an octroi at the rate of Rs. 1.75 per shirt and labour charges were Rs. 320. What should be the selling price of one shirt, if he wants a profit of 20%?
Sreenivas sells a table to Shiva at 10% profit and Shiva sells it to Mahesh at 10% loss. At what price did Sreenivas purchase the table if Mahesh paid Rs. 2178?
mcqs.explanation: Let the cost price of table for Sreenivas be Rs. x and given that, cost price of table for Mahesh = Rs. 2178. => (90%) of (110%) of x = Rs. 2178. => (90/100)(110/100)x = 2178 => x = (2178 * 100)/(9 * 11) => x = Rs. 2200

mcqs.question: If a trader sold two cars each at Rs. 325475 and gains 12% on the first and loses 12% on the second, then his profit or loss percent on the whole is?
mcqs.explanation: SP of each car is Rs. 325475, he gains 12% on first car and losses 12% on second car.In this case, there will be loss and percentage of loss is given by = [(profit%)(loss%)]/100 = (12)(12)/100 % = 1.44%

mcqs.question: If the cost price of 50 articles is equal to the selling price of 40 articles, then the gain or loss percent is?
mcqs.explanation: Given that, cost price of 50 article is equal to selling price of 40 articles.Let cost price of one article = Rs. 1Selling price of 40 articles = Rs. 50But Cost price of 40 articles = Rs. 40Therefore, the trader made profit.\Percentage of profit = 10/40 * 100 = 25%

mcqs.question: A dealer purchases 15 articles for Rs. 25 and sells 12 articles for Rs. 30. Find the profit percentage?
mcqs.explanation: L.C.M of 15 and 12 = 60CP of 60 articles = Rs. 100 (25 * 4)SP of 60 articles = Rs. 150 (30 * 5)Profit percentage = (150 - 100)/100 * 100 = 50%

mcqs.question: By selling 99 pens, a trader gains the cost of 33 pens. Find his gain percentage?
mcqs.explanation: Let the CP of each pen be Rs. 1.CP of 99 pens = Rs. 99Profit = Cost of 33 pens = Rs. 33Profit% = 33/99 * 100 = 33 1/3%

mcqs.question: A fruit vendor purchased 20 dozens of bananas at Rs. 15 per dozen. But one-fourth of the bananas were rotten and had to be thrown away. He sold two-third of the remaining bananas at Rs. 22.50 per dozen. At what price per dozen should he sell the remaining bananas to make neither a profit nor a loss?
mcqs.explanation: CP of 20 dozen of bananas = 15 * 20 = Rs. 300Number of bananas which are rotten = 1/4 * 20 = 5 dozen.SP of two-third of remaining bananas = (2/3 * 15) * 22.5 = Rs. 225SP of remaining 5 dozens of bananas to make no profit and no loss =(300 - 225) = Rs. 75.SP of 1 dozen bananas = 75/5 = Rs. 15.

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper sells 20% of his stock at 10% profit ans sells the remaining at a loss of 5%. He incurred an overall loss of Rs. 400. Find the total worth of the stock?
mcqs.explanation: Let the total worth of the stock be Rs. x.The SP of 20% of the stock = 1/5 * x * 1.1 = 11x/50The SP of 80% of the stock = 4/5 * x * 0.95 = 19x/25 = 38x/50Total SP = 11x/50 + 38x/50 = 49x/50Overall loss = x - 49x/50 = x/50x/50 = 400 => x = 20000

mcqs.question: After allowing a discount of 15% on the marked price, the selling price is Rs. 6800 for an article. If it was sold at marked price, there would have been a profit of 60%. The cost price of the article is?
The value of a machine depreciates at 20% per annum. If its present value is Rs. 1,50,000, at what price should it be sold after two years such that a profit of Rs. 24,000 is made?
mcqs.explanation: The value of the machine after two years = 0.8 * 0.8 * 1,50,000 = Rs. 96,000SP such that a profit of Rs. 24,000 is made = 96,000 + 24,000 = Rs. 1,20,000

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper sells 400 metres of cloth for Rs. 18000 at a loss of Rs.5 per metre. Find his cost price for one metre of cloth?
mcqs.explanation: SP per metre = 18000/400 = Rs. 45Loss per metre = Rs. 5CP per metre = 45 + 5 = Rs. 50

mcqs.question: Ravi purchased a refrigerator and a mobile phone for Rs. 15000 and Rs. 8000 respectively. He sold the refrigerator at a loss of 4 percent and the mobile phone at a profit of 10 percent. Overall he make a.
mcqs.explanation: Let the SP of the refrigerator and the mobile phone be Rs. r and Rs. m respectively.r = 15000(1 - 4/100) = 15000 - 600m = 8000(1 + 10/100) = 8000 + 800Total SP - Total CP = r + m - (15000 + 8000) = -600 + 800 = Rs. 200As this is positive, an overall profit of Rs. 200 was made.

mcqs.question: Mohit sold an article for Rs. 18000. Had he offered a discount of 10% on the selling price, he would have earned a profit of 8%. What is the cost price of the article?
mcqs.explanation: Let the CP be Rs. x.Had he offered 10% discount, profit = 8%Profit = 8/100 x and hence his SP = x + 8/100 x = Rs. 1.08x = 18000 - 10/100(18000) = 18000 - 1800 = Rs. 16200=> 1.08x = 16200=> x = 15000

mcqs.question: A trader marks his articles 20% more than the cost price. If he allows 20% discount, then find his gain or loss percent?
mcqs.explanation: Let CP of an article = RS. 100MP= Rs. 120Discount = 20%SP = M[(100 - d%)/100] = 120(80/100) = Rs. 96Clearly, the trader gets 4% loss.

mcqs.question: An article was sold after a discount of 20% and there was a gain of 20%. If the profit made on it was Rs. 6 less than the discount offered on it, find its selling price?
Mahesh marks an article 15% above the cost price of Rs. 540. What must be his discount percentage if he sells it at Rs. 496.80?

Ramesh purchased a refrigerator for Rs. 12500 after getting a discount of 20% on the labelled price. He spent Rs. 125 on transport and Rs. 250 on installation. At what price should it be sold so that the profit earned would be 10% if no discount was offered?
mcqs.explanation: Price at which the TV set is bought = Rs. 12,500Discount offered = 20%Marked Price = 12500 * 100/80 = Rs. 15625The total amount spent on transport and installation = 125 + 250 = Rs. 375\Total price of TV set = 15625 + 375 = Rs. 16000The price at which the TV should be sold to get a profit of 10% if no discount was offered = 16000 * 110/100 = Rs. 17600

mcqs.question: The successive discounts 20% and 15% are equal to a single discount of?
mcqs.explanation: Let the CP of an article be Rs. 100Given that successive discounts are 20% and 15%.SP = 85% of 80% of 100 = (85/100)(80/100)(100)=> SP = Rs. 68Clearly, single discount is 32%.

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper purchased 70 kg of potatoes for Rs. 420 and sold the whole lot at the rate of Rs. 6.50 per kg. What will be his gain percent?
Sam purchased 20 dozens of toys at the rate of Rs. 375 per dozen. He sold each one of them at the rate of Rs. 33. What was his percentage profit?
The sale price of an article including the sales tax is Rs. 616. The rate of sales tax is 10%. If the shopkeeper has made a profit of 12%, then the cost price of the article is:
Jacob brought a scooter for a certain sum of money. He spent 10% of the cost on repairs and sold the scooter for a profit of Rs. 1100. How much did he spend on repairs if he made a profit of 20%?
mcqs.explanation: Let the C.P. be Rs. x. Then, 20% of x = 110020/100 * x = 1100 => x = 5500C.P. = Rs. 5500, expenditure on repairs = 10%Actual price = Rs. (100 * 5500)/110 = Rs. 5000Expenditures on repairs = (5500 - 5000) = Rs. 500.

mcqs.question: The ratio of the cost price and the selling price is 4:5. The profit percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. = Rs. 4x. Then, S.P. = Rs. 5xGain = (5x - 4x) = Rs. xGain % = (x * 100)/ 4x = 25%.

mcqs.question: The ratio between the sale price and the cost price of an article is 7:5. What is the ratio between the profit and the cost price of that article?
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. = Rs. 5x and S.P. = Rs. 7x. Then, Gain = Rs. 2x Required ratio = 2x : 5x = 2:5

mcqs.question: A man gains 20% by selling an article for a certain price. If the sells it at double the price, the percentage of profit will be:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. = Rs. x. Then, S.P. = Rs. (12% of x) = Rs. 6x/5New S.P. = 2 * 6x/5 = Rs. 12x/5Profit = 12x/5 - x = Rs. 7x/5Profit = 7x/5 * 1/x * 100 = 140%.

mcqs.question: If selling price is doubled, the profit triples. Find the profit percent:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. be Rs. x and S.P. be Rx. y. Then, 3(y - x) = (2y - x) => y = 2x Profit = (y - x) = Rs. (2x - x) = Rs. x Profit % = x/x * 100 = 100%.

mcqs.question: In a certain store, the profit is 320% of the cost. If the cost increases by 25% but the selling price remains constant, approximately what percentage of the selling price is the profit?
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. = Rs. 100. Then, profit = Rs. 320, S.P. = Rs. 420New C.P. = 125% of Rs. 100 = Rs. 125.New S.P. = Rs. 420Profit = 420 - 125 = Rs. 295Required percentage = 295/420 * 100 = 1475/21 = 70%

mcqs.question: The profit earned by selling an article for Rs. 832 is equal to the loss incurred when the same article is sold for Rs. 448. What should be the sale price for making 50% profit?

The percentage profit earned by selling an article for Rs. 1920 is equal to the percentage loss incurred by selling the same article for Rs. 1280. At what price should the article be sold to make 25% profit?
If the cost price of 12 pens is equal to the selling price of 8 pens, the gain percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. of each pen be Re. 1. Then, C.P. of 8 pens = Rs. 8; S.P. of 8 pens = Rs. 12.Gain % = 4/8 * 100 = 50%

mcqs.question: If the selling price of 50 articles is equal to the cost price of 40 articles, then the loss or gain percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. of each article be Re. 1.Then, C.P. of 50 articles = Rs. 50;S.P. of 50 articles = Rs. 40.Loss % = 10/50 * 100 = 20%

mcqs.question: On an order of 5 dozen boxes of a consumer product, a retailer receives an extra dozen free. This is equivalent to allowing him a discount of:
mcqs.explanation: Clearly, the retailer gets 1 dozen out of 6 dozens free.Equivalent discount = 1/6 * 100 = 16 2/3%.

mcqs.question: A vendor bought toffees at 6 for a rupee. How many for a rupee must he sell to gain 20%?
mcqs.explanation: C.P. of 6 toffees = Re. 1S.P. of 6 toffees = 120% of Re. 1 = Rs. 6/5For Rs. 6/5, toffees sold = 6. For re. 1.Toffees sold = 6 * 5/6 = 5

mcqs.question: By selling 12 toffees for a rupee, a man loses 20%. How many for a rupee should be sell to get a gain of 20%?
mcqs.explanation: Let S.P. of 12 toffees be Rs. x. Then, 80:1 = 120:x or x = 120/180 = 3/2For Rs. 3/2, toffees sold = 12.For Re. 1, toffees sold = 12 * 2/3 = 8

mcqs.question: Arun purchased 30 kg of wheat at the rate of Rs. 11.50 per kg and 20 kg of wheat at the rate of 14.25 per kg. He mixed the two and sold the mixture. Approximately what price per kg should be sell the mixture to make 30% profit?

By mixing two brands of tea and selling the mixture at the rate of Rs. 177 per kg. a shopkeeper makes a profit of 18%. If to every 2 kg of one brand costing Rs. 200 per kg, 3 kg of the other brand is added, then how much per kg does the other brand cost?
mcqs.explanation: Let the cost of the brand be Rs. X per kg. C.P. of 5 kg = (2 * 200 + 3 * x) = Rs. (400 + 3x)S.P of 5 kg = Rs. (5 * 177) = Rs. 885[885 - (400 + 3x)]/(400 + 3x) * 100 = 1824250 - 150x = 3600 + 27x177x = 20650 => x = 116 2/3So, cost of the other brand = Rs. 116.66.

mcqs.question: A fair price shopkeeper takes 10% profit on his goods. He lost 20% goods during theft. His loss percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Suppose he has 100 items. Let C.P. of each item be Re. 1.Total cost = Rs. 100. Number of items left after theft = 80.S.P. of each item = Rs. 1.10Total sale =  1.10 * 80 = Rs. 88Hence, loss % = 12/100 * 100 = 12%

mcqs.question: A sells a bicycle to B at a profit of 20%. B sells it to C at a profit of 25%. If C pays Rs. 225 for it, the cost price of the bicycle for A is:

A manufacturer sells a pair of glasses to a wholesale dealer at a profit of 18%. The wholesaler sells the same to retailer at a profit of 20%. The retailer in turn sells them to a customer for Rs. 30.09, there by earning a profit of 25%. The cost price for the manufacturer is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the cost price for the manufacturer be Rs. x. Then, 125% of 120% of 118% of x = 30.09.125/100 * 120/100 * 118/100 * x = 3009/100177/100 x = 3009/100 => x = 17

mcqs.question: A man buys an article for 10% less than its value and sells it for 10% more than its value. His gain or loss percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the article be worth Rs. x.C.P. 90% of Rs. x = Rs. 9x/10S.P. = 110% of Rs. x = Rs. 11x/10Gain = (11x/10 - 9x/10) = Rs. x/5Gain % = x/5 * 10/9x * 100 = 22 2/9 % > 20%

mcqs.question: If 5% more is gained by selling an article for Rs. 350 than by selling it for Rs. 340, the cost of the article is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. be Rs. x. Then, 5% of x = 350 - 340 = 10x/20 = 10 => x = 200

mcqs.question: The cash difference between the selling prices of an article at a profit of 4% and 6% is Rs. 3. The ratio of the two selling prices is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. of the article be Rs. x. Then, required ratio = 104% of x / 106% of x = 104/106 = 52/53 = 52:53

mcqs.question: A person purchases 90 clocks and sells 40 clocks at a gain of 10% and 50 clocks at a gain of 20%. If he sold all of them at a uniform profit of 15%, then he would have got Rs. 40 less. The cost price of each clock is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. of clock be Rs. x. Then, C.P. of 90 clocks = Rs. 90x.[(110% of 40x) + (120% of 50x)] - (115% of 90x) = 4044x + 60x - 103.5x = 400.5x = 40 => x = 80

mcqs.question: Albert buys 4 horses and 9 cows for Rs. 13,400. If he sells the horses at 10% profit and the cows at 20% profit, then he earns a total profit of Rs. 1880. The cost of a horse is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. of each horse be Rs. x and C.P. of each cow be Rs. y. Then, 4x + 9y = 13400 -- (i)And, 10% of 4x + 20% of 9y = 18802/5 x + 9/5 y = 1880 => 2x + 9y = 9400 -- (ii)Solving (i) and (ii), we get : x = 2000 and y = 600.Cost price of each horse = Rs. 2000.

mcqs.question: The price of a VCR is marked at Rs. 12,000. If successive discounts of 15%, 10% and 5% be allowed, then at what price does a customer buy it?
By selling an umbrella for Rs. 300, a shop keeper gains 20%. During a clearance sale, the shopkeeper allows a discount of 10% on the marked price. His gain percent during  the sale is:
mcqs.explanation: Marked price = Rs. 300C.P. = 100/120 * 300 = Rs. 250Sale price = 90% of Rs. 300 = Rs. 270Required gain % = 20/250 * 100 = 8%.

mcqs.question: The cost price of an article is 64% of the marked price. Calculate the gain percent after allowing a discount of 12%?
mcqs.explanation: Let marked price = Rs. 100. Then, C.P. = RS. 64, S.P. = Rs. 88Gain % = 24/64 * 100 = 37.5%.

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper sold an article offering a discount of 5% and earned a profit of 23.5%. What would have been the percentage of profit earned if no discount was offered?
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P. be Rs. 100. Then, S.P. = Rs. 123.50Let marked price be Rs. x. Then, 95/100 x = 123.50x = 12350/95 = Rs. 130Now, S.P. = Rs. 130, C.P. = Rs. 100Profit % = 30%.

mcqs.question: A man buys 10 articles for Rs. 8 and Sells them at the rate of Rs. 1.25 per article. His gain is:
mcqs.explanation: C.P of 10 articles = Rs. 8 S.P of 10 articles = Rs. (1.25 Ã— 10) = Rs. 12.50 Gain = (4.5/8 Ã— 100)%                  = 56 ¼%

mcqs.question: There would be 10% loss if a toy is said at Rs. 10.80 per piece. At what price should it be sold to earn a profit of 20%?
mcqs.explanation: 90 : 10.80 :: 120 : x X = (10.80 Ã—120)/90             = 14.40 Hence, the toy must be sold for Rs. 14.40

mcqs.question: There would be 10% loss if rice is sold at Rs. 5.40 per kg. At what price per kg should it  be sold to earn a profit of 20%
A man sells 320 mangoes at the cost of 400 mangoes. His gain percent is:
mcqs.explanation: Let C.P of each mango  = Rs. 1 C.P of 320 mangoes = Rs. 320S.P of 320 mangoes = Rs. 400 Gain = (80/320 Ã— 100)%                         = 25 %

mcqs.question: If books bought at prices ranging from Rs. 200 to Rs. 350 are sold at prices ranging from Rs. 300 to Rs. 425. What is the greatest possible profit that might be made in selling 8 books?
mcqs.explanation: Profit is maximum when C.P is minimum and S.P Maximum.Thus, C.P = Rs. (200 Ã— 8)                                            = Rs. 1600 S.P  =  Rs. (425 Ã— 8)                                            =  Rs. 3400 Gain  =  Rs. 1800

mcqs.question: If I purchased 11 books for Rs. 10 and sold all at the rate of 10 books for Rs. 11, the profit percent

mcqs.question: Aloke bought 25kg of rice at the rate of Rs. 6 per kg and 35 kg of rice at the rate of Rs. 7 per kg. He mixed the two and sold the mixture at the rate of Rs. 6.75 per kg. What was his gain or loss on the transaction?

mcqs.question: A man sold 20 articles for Rs. 60 and gained 20%. How many articles did he buy for Rs.60?

mcqs.explanation: Gain % = {Error/(True value - error) Ã— 100} %  = (100/900 Ã— 100)%                                             = 11 1/9%

mcqs.explanation: He sells 20 toffees S.P = Rs. 1 and loss = 4% C.P = (11/96 Ã— 1)                = Rs. 25/24 Gain = 20% S.P = Rs. (120/100 Ã— 25/24)               = Rs. 5/4 Rs. 5/4 toffees sold = 20 Rs. 1 toffees sold = (20 Ã— 4/5)                                            = 16

mcqs.question: In a kilometer race, A beats B by 50 meters or 10 seconds. What time does A take to complete the race?
mcqs.explanation: Time taken by B run 1000 meters = (1000 * 10)/50 = 200 sec.Time taken by A = 200 - 10 = 190 sec.

mcqs.question: A can give B 100 meters start and C 200 meters start in a kilometer race. How much start can B give C in a kilometer race?
mcqs.explanation: A runs 1000 m while B runs 900 m and C runs 800 m.The number of meters that C runs when B runs 1000 m,= (1000 * 800)/900 = 8000/9 = 888.88 m.B can give C = 1000 - 888.88 = 111.12 m.

mcqs.question: A can run a kilometer race in 4 1/2 min while B can run same race in 5 min. How many meters start can A give B in a kilometer race, so that the race mat end in a dead heat?
mcqs.explanation: A can give B (5 min - 4 1/2 min) = 30 sec start.The distance covered by B in 5 min = 1000 m.Distance covered in 30 sec = (1000 * 30)/300 = 100 m.A can give B 100m start.

mcqs.question: In a race of 1000 m, A can beat by 100 m, in a race of 800m, B can beat C by 100m. By how many meters will A beat C in a race of 600 m?
mcqs.explanation: When A runs 1000 m, B runs 900 m and when B runs 800 m, C runs 700 m.When B runs 900 m, distance that C runs = (900 * 700)/800 = 6300/8 = 787.5 m.In a race of 1000 m, A beats C by (1000 - 787.5) = 212.5 m to C.In a race of 600 m, the number of meters by which A beats C = (600 * 212.5)/1000 = 127.5 m.

mcqs.question: In a game of billiards, A can give B 20 points in 60 and he can give C 30 points in 60. How many points can B give C in a game of 100?
mcqs.explanation: A scores 60 while B score 40 and C scores 30.The number of points that C scores when B scores 100 = (100 * 30)/40 = 25 * 3 = 75.In a game of 100 points, B gives (100 - 75) = 25 points to C.

The sum of three consecutive integers is 102. Find the lowest of the three?
mcqs.explanation: Three consecutive numbers can be taken as (P - 1), P, (P + 1).So, (P - 1) + P + (P + 1) = 1023P = 102 => P = 34.The lowest of the three = (P - 1) = 34 - 1 = 33.

mcqs.question: The sum of the two digits of a number is 10. If the number is subtracted from the number obtained by reversing its digits, the result is 54. Find the number?
mcqs.explanation: Any two digit number can be written as (10P + Q), where P is the digit in the tens place and Q is the digit in the units place.P + Q = 10 ----- (1)(10Q + P) - (10P + Q) = 549(Q - P) = 54(Q - P) = 6 ----- (2)Solve (1) and (2) P = 2 and Q = 8The required number is = 28

mcqs.question: The sum of three consecutive even numbers is 42. Find the middle number of the three?
mcqs.explanation: Three consecutive even numbers (2P - 2), 2P, (2P + 2).(2P - 2) + 2P + (2P + 2) = 426P = 42 => P = 7.The middle number is: 2P = 14.

mcqs.question: The numerator of a certain fraction is 8 less than the denominator. If 3 is added to the numerator and 3 is subtracted from the denominator, the fraction becomes 3/4. Find the original fraction?
mcqs.explanation: The denominator be P, the numerator will be (P - 8).The fraction will be (P - 8)/P.Adding 3 to the numerator and subtracting 3 from the denominator, (P - 8 + 3)/(P - 3) = 3/4.(P - 5)/(P - 3) = 3/4P = 20 - 9 => P = 11.The fraction is: 3/11.

mcqs.question: The sum of the present ages of two persons A and B is 60. If the age of A is twice that of B, find the sum of their ages 5 years hence?
mcqs.explanation: A + B = 60, A = 2B2B + B = 60 => B = 20 then A = 40.5 years, their ages will be 45 and 25.Sum of their ages = 45 + 25 = 70.

mcqs.question: The ratio of the present ages of P and Q is 3:4. 5 years ago, the ratio of their ages was 5:7. Find the their present ages?
mcqs.explanation: Their present ages be 3X and 4X.5 years age, the ratio of their ages was 5:7, then (3X - 5):(4X - 5) = 5:7X = 35 - 25 => X = 10.Their present ages are: 30, 40.

mcqs.question: A man said to his son, "I was two-third of your present age when you were born". If the present age of the man is 48 years, find the present age of the son?
mcqs.explanation: Present age of the son be P, he was born P years ago.The age of the man was: (48 - P).His age when the son was born should be equal to 2/3 of P.(48 - P) = 2/3 P5P = 144 => P = 28.8

mcqs.question: Sachin is younger than Rahul by 4 years. If their ages are in the respective ratio of 7:9, how old is Sachin?
mcqs.explanation: Let Rahul's age be x years. Then, Sachin's age = (x - 7) years.(x - 7)/x = 7/92x = 63 => x = 31.5Hence, Sachin's age = (x - 7) = 24.5 years.

mcqs.question: The ratio between the present ages of P and Q is 6:7. If Q is 4 years old than P, what will be the ratio of the ages of P and Q after 4 years?
mcqs.explanation: Let P's age and Q's age be 6x and 7x years respectively. Then, 7x - 6x = 4 => x = 4 Required ratio = (6x + 4) : (7x + 4)28 : 32 = 7:8

mcqs.question: The ratio between the present ages of P and Q is 5:7 respectively. If the difference between Q's present age and P's age after 6 years is 2. What is the total of P's and Q's present ages?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of P and Q be 5x and 7x years respectively. Then, 7x - (5x + 6) = 2 2x = 8 => x = 4 Required sum = 5x + 7x = 12x = 48 years.

mcqs.question: At present, the ratio between the ages of Arun and Deepak is 4:3. After 6 years, Arun's age will be 26 years. What is the age of Deepak at present?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of Arun and Deepak be 4x and 3x years respectively. Then, 4x + 6  = 26 => x = 5 Deepak's age = 3x = 15 years.

mcqs.question: Present ages of X and Y are in the ratio 5:6 respectively. Seven years hence this ratio will become 6:7 respectively. What is X's present age in years?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of X and Y be 5x and 6x years respectively. Then, (5x + 7)/(6x + 7) = 6/7 7(5x + 7) = 6(6x + 7) => x = 7 X's present age = 5x = 35 years.

mcqs.question: Present ages of Sameer and Anand are in the ratio of 5:4 respectively. Three years hence, the ratio of their ages will become 11:9 respectively. What is Anand's present age in years?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of Sameer and Anand be 5x and 4x years respectively. Then, (5x + 3)/(4x + 3) = 11/9 9(5x + 3) = 11(4x + 3) => x = 6Anand's present age = 4x = 24 years.

mcqs.question: Six years ago, the ratio of ages of Kunal and Sagar was 6:5. Four years hence, the ratio of their ages will be 11:10. What is Sagar's age at present?
mcqs.explanation: Let the ages of Kunal and Sagar 6 years ago be 6x and 5x years respectively. Then, [(6x + 6) + 4] / [(5x + 6) + 4] = 11/10 10(6x + 10) = 11(5x + 10) => x = 2 Sagar's present age = (5x + 6) = 16 years.

mcqs.question: The ratio of the present age of two brothers is 1:2 and 5 years back, the ratio was 1:3. What will be the ratio of their ages after 5 years?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of the two brothers be x and 2x years respectively. Then, (x - 5)/(2x - 5) = 1/3 3(x - 5) = (2x - 5) => x = 10 Required ratio = (x + 5) : (2x + 5) = 15 : 25 = 3:5

mcqs.question: The present ages of three persons are in proportions 4:7:9. Eight years ago, the sum of their ages was 56. Find their present ages.
mcqs.explanation: Let their present ages be 4x, 7x and 9x years respectively. Then, (4x - 8) + (7x - 8) + (9x - 8) = 56 20x = 80 => x = 4 Their present ages are 16, 28 and 36 years respectively.

mcqs.question: The ratio between the school ages of Neelam and Shaan is 5:6 respectively. If the ratio between the one-third age of Neelam and half of Shaan's age of 5:9, then what is the school age of Shaan?
mcqs.explanation: Let the school ages of Neelam and Shaan be 5x and 6x years respectively. Then, (1/3 * 5x)/(1/2 * 6x) = 5/9 15 = 15 Thus, Shaan's age cannot be determined.

mcqs.question: The ratio between the present ages of A and B is 5:3 respectively. The ratio between A's age 4 years ago and B's age 4 years hence is 1:1. What is the ratio between A's age 4 years hence and B's age 4 years ago?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of A and B be 5x and 3x years respectively. Then, (5x - 4)/(3x + 4) = 1/1 2x = 8 => x = 4 Required ratio = (5x + 4):(3x - 4) = 24:8 = 3:1

mcqs.question: A is two years older than B who is twice as old as C. If the total of the ages of A, B and C be 27, then how old is B?
mcqs.explanation: Let C's age be x years. Then, B's age = 2x years. A's age = (2x + 2) years. (2x + 2) + 2x + x = 27 5x = 25 => x = 5 Hence, B's age = 2x = 10 years.

mcqs.question: A man is 24 years older than his son. In two years, his age will be twice the age of his son. The present age of the son is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the son's present age be x years. Then, man's present age = (x + 24) years. (x + 24) + 2 = 2(x + 2)x + 26 = 2x + 4 => x = 22.

mcqs.question: Eighteen years ago, a father was three times as old as his son. Now the father is only twice as old his son. Then the sum of the present ages of the son and the father is:
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of the father and son be 2x and x years respectively. Then, (2x - 18) = 3(x - 18) => x = 36 Required sum = (2x + x) = 108 years.

mcqs.question: A person's present age is two-fifth of the age of his mother. After 8 years, he will be one-half of the age of his mother. How old id the mother at present?
mcqs.explanation: Let the mother's present age be x years. Then, the person's present age = 2/5 x years.(2/5 x + 8) = 1/2 (x + 8)2(2x + 40) = 5(x + 8) => x = 40

mcqs.question: Tanya's grandfather was 8 times older to her 16 years ago. He would be 3 times of her age 8 years from now. Eight years ago, what was the ratio of Tanya's age to that of her grandfather?
mcqs.explanation: 16 years ago, let T = x years and G = 8x years. After 8 years from now, T = (x + 16 + 8) years and G = (8x + 16 + 8) years. 8x + 24 = 3(x + 24) => 5x = 48 8 years ago, T/G = (x + 8)/(8x + 8) = (48/5 + 8) / (8 * 48/5 + 8) = 88/424 = 11/53

mcqs.question: The age of father 10 years ago was thrice the age of his son. Ten years hence, father's age was five times the age of the son. After 6 years, son's age will be:
mcqs.explanation: Let the age of father and son 10 years ago be 3x and x years respectively. Then, (3x + 10) + 10 = 2[(x + 10) + 10] 3x + 20 = 2x + 40 => x = 20. Required ratio = (3x + 10):(x + 10) = 70:30 = 7:3

mcqs.question: The sum of the present ages of father and his son is 60 years. Six years ago, father's age was five times the age of the son. After 6 years, son's age will be:
mcqs.explanation: Let the present ages of son and father be x and (60 - x) years respectively. Then, (60 - x) - 6 = 5(x - 6) 6x = 84 => x = 14 Son's age after 6 years = (x + 6) = 20 years.

mcqs.question: The total age of A and B is 12 years more than the total age of B and C. C is how many years younger than A?
options: C) C is elder than A

mcqs.question: Q is as much younger than R as he is older than T. If the sum of the ages of R and T is 50 years. What is definitely the difference between R and Q's age?
mcqs.explanation: R - Q = R - T Q = T. Also R + T = 50; R + Q = 50 So, (R - Q) cannot be determined.

mcqs.question: Rajan got married 8 years ago. His present age is 6/5 times his age at the time of his marriage. Rajan's sister was 10 years younger to him at the time of his marriage. The age of Rajan's sister is:
mcqs.explanation: Let Rajan's present age be x years. Then, his age at the time of marriage = (x - 8) years.x = 6/5 (x - 8) 5x = 6x - 48 => x = 48Rajan's sister's age at the time of his marriage = (x - 8) - 10 = 30 years.Rajan's sister's present age = (30 + 8) = 38 years.

mcqs.question: The sum of the ages of 5 children born at the intervals of 3 years each is 50 years. What is the age of the youngest child?
mcqs.explanation: Let the ages of the children be x, (x + 3), (x + 6), (x + 9) and (x +12) years. Then, x + (x + 3) + (x + 6) + (x + 9) + (x + 12) = 505x = 20 => x = 4.Age of youngest child = x = 4 years.

mcqs.question: A father said to his son, "I was as old as you are at present at the time of your birth." If the father's age is 38 years now, the son's age five years back was:
mcqs.explanation: Let the son's present age be x years. Then, (38 - x) = x2x = 38 => x = 19Son's age 5 years back = (19 - 5) = 14 years.

mcqs.question: Ayesha's father was 38 years of age when she was born while her mother was 36 years old when her brother four years younger to her was born. What is the difference between the ages of her parents?
mcqs.explanation: Mother's age when Ayesha's brother was born = 36 years.Father's age when Ayesha's brother was born = (38 + 4) = 42 years.Required difference = (42 - 36) = 6 years.

mcqs.question: A person was asked to state his age in years. His reply was, "Take my age three years hence, multiply it by 3 and then subtract three times my age three years ago and you will know how old I am." What was the age of the person?
mcqs.explanation: Let the present age of the person be x years.Then, 3(x + 3)  - 3(x - 3) = x3x + 9 - 3x + 9 = x => x = 18

mcqs.question: The sum of the ages of a son and father is 56 years after four years the age of the father will be three times that of the son. Their ages respectively are:
mcqs.explanation: Present ages of son and father be x years (56 -x)years (56- x +4) = 3(x + 4) or 4x =48 or x = 12 Ages are 12 years, 44 years

mcqs.question: In 10 years, A will be twice as old as B was 10 years ago. If A is now 9 years older than B, the present age of B is
mcqs.explanation: Present ages of B and A be x years and (x +9) years (x +9 +10) = 2 (x -10) or x =39

mcqs.question: Pushpa is twice as old as Rita was two years ago if the difference between their ages is 2 years, how old is Pushpa today?
mcqs.explanation: Rita's age 2 years ago be x years Pushpa's present age =(2x) years 2x “(x +2) =2 => x =4 Therefore pushpa's present age = 8 years

mcqs.question: The sum of the ages of a father and son is 45 years five years ago the product of their ages was 4 times the father's age at that time. The present ages of the father and son respectively are:
mcqs.explanation: Present ages of father and son be x years and (45-x) years (x -5)(45 “x -5) = 4(x -5) -x2 +41x -180 =0 or x =36. Therefore, present ages of father and son are 36 years and 9 years

mcqs.question: Five years ago viney's age was one-third of the age of Vikas and now viney's age is 17 years, what is the present age of Vikas?
mcqs.explanation: Present age of vikas be x years17 “ 5 = 1/3 (x -5) or x -5 = 36 or x =41

mcqs.question: The age of Arvind's father is 4 times his age if 5 years ago father's age was 7 times of the age of his son at the time. What is Arvind's father's present age?
mcqs.explanation: Arvind's age be x years Father's age = 4x years. Therefore (4x -5) =7(x -5) or 3x = 30 => x =10 Arvind's father's age is 40 years

mcqs.question: 10 years ago, chandravati's mother was 4 times older than her daughter, after 10 years the mother will be twice older than the daughter. The present age of chandravati is:
mcqs.explanation: Chandravati's age 10 years ago be x years Mother's age 10 years ago =(4x)years 2(x +20) = (4x +20)=> x =10 Present age of Chandravati = (x +10) = 20 years

mcqs.question: Kamala got married 6 years ago, Today her age is 1 ¼ times her age at the time of marriage. Her son's age is (1/10) times her age. Her son's age is:
mcqs.explanation: Kamala's age 6 years ago be x years Kamala's present age =(x +6) years Therefore x +6 = 5/4 x or 4x + 24 =5x or x =24 Kamala's present age = 30 years Son's present age = (1/10 x 30) = 3 years

mcqs.question: Ratio of Ashok's age to Pradeep's age is equal to 4: 3. Ashok will be 26 years old after 6 years How old is Pradeep now?
mcqs.explanation: Ashok's age = 4x and pradeep's age =3x years Therefore, 4x +6 = 26 => x = 5 Pradeep age = 3x = 15 years

mcqs.question: The ratio of the ages of father and son at present is 6: 1 after 5 years the ratio will become 7: 2. The present age of the son is
mcqs.explanation: = 7/2=> 2(6x +5) = 7(x +5) => x =5 Therefore, Son's present age = 5 years

mcqs.question: The ratio between the ages of A and B at present is 2: 3. Five years hence the ratio of their ages will be 3: 4. What is the present age of A?
mcqs.explanation: Ages of A and B be 2x and 3x years  = 3/4=> 4(2x + 5) = 3 (3x +5) => x =5 Therefore, A's parent age = 2x = 10 years

mcqs.question: One year ago the ratio between Samir and Ashok's age was 4: 3 one year hence the ratio of their age will be 5: 4. What is the sum of their present ages in years?
mcqs.explanation: One year ago be 4x and 3x years  = 5/4 => 4(4x +2) = 5(3x +2) => x =2. Present ages = (4x+1+3x+1) = 16 Years

mcqs.question: Three years ago the average age of A and B was 18 years with C joining them, then the average becomes 22 years. How old is C now?
mcqs.explanation: Sum of ages of A and B, 3 Years ago =(18 x 2) = 36 Years Sum of ages of A, B and C, Now = (22 x 3) = 66 Years Sum of ages of A and B, Now = (36 +6)Years = 42 Years Therefore,  C's age =  (66 - 42)Years = 24 Years

mcqs.question: Jayesh is as much younger to Anil as he is older to Prashant if the sum of the ages of anil and Prashant is 48 years, what is the age of Jayesh?
mcqs.explanation: Anil's  age = x yearsPrashant's age = (48 -x)Years The age of Jayesh be P years P “(48 -x) = x “p => 2P =48 => P= 24 Years

mcqs.question: The ratio of Vimal's age and Aruna's age is 3: 5 and sum of their ages are 80 years. The ratio of their ages after 10 years will be?
mcqs.explanation: 3x + 5x  = 80 => x =10 Ratio of their ages after 10 Years = (3x +10 : 5x + 10) = 40 : 60 =  2 : 3

mcqs.question: The years ago A was half of B of age if the ratio of their present ages is 3: 4. What will be the total of their present ages?
mcqs.explanation: A's age 10 Years ago = x years B's age 10 Years ago = 2x years  = 3/4 => 4(x+10) = 3(2x +10) => x= 5 Total of their present ages =(x +10 +2x +10) = (3x +20) = 35 Years

mcqs.question: The present ages of three persons in proportions 4 : 7 : 9. Eight years ago, the sum of their ages was 56. Find their present ages (in years).

Q is as much younger than R as he is older than T. If the sum of the ages of R and T is 50 years, what is definitely the difference between R and Q's age?
A father is said to his son, " I was as old as you, are at present at the time of your birth. If the father's age is 38 years now, the son's age five years back was
A mixture of 150 liters of wine and water contains 20% water. How much more water should be added so that water becomes 25% of the new mixture?
mcqs.explanation: Number of liters of water in150 liters of the mixture = 20% of 150 = 20/100 * 150 = 30 liters.P liters of water added to the mixture to make water 25% of the new mixture.Total amount of water becomes (30 + P) and total volume of mixture is (150 + P).(30 + P) = 25/100 * (150 + P)120 + 4P = 150 + P => P = 10 liters.

mcqs.question: A vessel contains 20 liters of a mixture of milk and water in the ratio 3:2. 10 liters of the mixture are removed and replaced with an equal quantity of pure milk. If the process is repeated once more, find the ratio of milk and water in the final mixture obtained?
mcqs.explanation: Milk = 3/5 * 20 = 12 liters, water = 8 litersIf 10 liters of mixture are removed, amount of milk removed = 6 liters and amount of water removed = 4 liters.Remaining milk = 12 - 6 = 6 litersRemaining water = 8 - 4 = 4 liters10 liters of pure milk are added, therefore total milk = (6 + 10) = 16 liters.The ratio of milk and water in the new mixture = 16:4 = 4:1If the process is repeated one more time and 10 liters of the mixture are removed, then amount of milk removed = 4/5 * 10 = 8 liters.Amount of water removed = 2 liters.Remaining milk = (16 - 8) = 8 liters.Remaining water = (4 -2) = 2 liters.The required ratio of milk and water in the final mixture obtained = (8 + 10):2 = 18:2 = 9:1.

mcqs.question: In what ratio should two varieties of sugar of Rs.18 per kg and Rs.24 kg be mixed together to get a mixture whose cost is Rs.20 per kg?
How many liters of oil at Rs.40 per liter should be mixed with 240 liters of a second variety of oil at Rs.60 per liter so as to get a mixture whose cost is Rs.52 per liter?
Two varieties of wheat - A and B costing Rs. 9 per kg and Rs. 15 per kg were mixed in the ratio 3 : 7. If 5 kg of the mixture is sold at 25% profit, find the profit made?
mcqs.explanation: Let the quantities of A and B mixed be 3x kg and 7x kg.Cost of 3x kg of A = 9(3x) = Rs. 27xCost of 7x kg of B = 15(7x) = Rs. 105xCost of 10x kg of the mixture = 27x + 105x = Rs. 132xCost of 5 kg of the mixture = 132x/10x (5) = Rs. 66Profit made in selling 5 kg of the mixture = 25/100 (cost of 5 kg of the mixture) = 25/100 * 66 = Rs. 16.50

mcqs.question: In a mixture of milk and water, the proportion of milk by weight was 80%. If, in a 180 gm mixture, 36 gms of pure milk is added, what would be the percentage of milk in the mixture formed?

In a can, there is a mixture of milk and water in the ratio 4 : 5. If it is filled with an additional 8 litres of milk the can would be full and ratio of milk and water would become 6 : 5. Find the capacity of the can?
mcqs.explanation: Let the capacity of the can be T litres.Quantity of milk in the mixture before adding milk = 4/9 (T - 8)After adding milk, quantity of milk in the mixture = 6/11 T.6T/11 - 8 = 4/9(T - 8)10T = 792 - 352 => T = 44.

mcqs.question: In what ratio should a variety of rice costing Rs. 6 per kg be mixed with another variety of rice costing Rs. 8.75 per kg to obtain a mixture costing Rs. 7.50 per kg?
mcqs.explanation: Let us say the ratio of the quantities of cheaper and dearer varieties = x : yBy the rule of allegation, x/y = (87.5 - 7.50) / (7.50 - 6) = 5/6

mcqs.question: A mixture of 70 litres of milk and water contains 10% water. How many litres of water should be added to the mixture so that the mixture contains 12 1/2% water?
mcqs.explanation: Quantity of milk in the mixture = 90/100 (70) = 63 litres.After adding water, milk would form 87 1/2% of the mixture.Hence, if quantity of mixture after adding x liters of water, (87 1/2) / 100 x = 63 => x = 72Hence 72 - 70 = 2 litres of water must be added.

mcqs.question: All the water in container A which was filled to its brim was poured into two containers B and C. The quantity of water in container B was 62.5% less than the capacity of container A. If 148 liters was now transferred from C to B, then both the containers would have equal quantities of water. What was the initial quantity of water in container A?
mcqs.explanation: B has 62.5% or (5/8) of the water in A. Therefore, let the quantity of water in container A(initially) be 8k.Quantity of water in B = 8k - 5k = 3k.Quantity of water in container C = 8k - 3k = 5kContainer:               A   B    CQuantity of water: 8k  3k   5kIt is given that if 148 liters was transferred from container C to container B, then both the containers would have equal quantities of water.5k - 148 = 3k + 148 => 2k = 296 => k = 148The initial quantity of water in A = 8k = 8 * 148 = 1184 liters.

mcqs.question: Two vessels P and Q contain 62.5% and 87.5% of alcohol respectively. If 2 litres from vessel P is mixed with 4 litres from vessel Q, the ratio of alcohol and water in the resulting mixture is?
mcqs.explanation: Quantity of alcohol in vessel P = 62.5/100 * 2 = 5/4 litresQuantity of alcohol in vessel Q = 87.5/100 * 4 = 7/2 litresQuantity of alcohol in the mixture formed = 5/4 + 7/2 = 19/4 = 4.75 litresAs 6 litres of mixture is formed, ratio of alcohol and water in the mixture formed = 4.75 : 1.25 = 19 : 5.

mcqs.question: A vessel of capacity 90 litres is fully filled with pure milk. Nine litres of milk is removed from the vessel and replaced with water. Nine litres of the solution thus formed is removed and replaced with water. Find the quantity of pure milk in the final milk solution?
mcqs.explanation: Let the initial quantity of milk in vessel be T litres.Let us say y litres of the mixture is taken out and replaced by water for n times, alternatively.Quantity of milk finally in the vessel is then given by [(T - y)/T]n * T For the given problem, T = 90, y = 9 and n = 2.Hence, quantity of  milk finally in the vessel = [(90 - 9)/90]2 (90) =  72.9 litres.

mcqs.question: The ratio in which the price at Rs.7.20 a kg be mixed with rice at Rs. 5.70 a kg to produce a mixture worth Rs.6.30 a kg is:
mcqs.explanation: (Dearer Rice): (Cheaper Rice) = 60 : 90 = 2:3

mcqs.question: In what ratio must a grocer mix teas worth Rs.60 a kg and Rs.65 a kg.So that by selling the mixture at Rs. 68.20 a kg, He may gain 10%?
mcqs.explanation: S.P of  1kg mix = RS.68.20, Gain = 10%C.P of 1kg mix =Rs.(100/110 x 68.20) =Rs.62(Cheaper Tea) : (Dearer Tea) = 3 : 2

mcqs.question: In what ratio must water be mixed with milk to gain 16 2/3 % by selling the mixture at cost price?
mcqs.explanation: Let the C.P of the milk be Re. 1 per litre             Then S.P of 1 litre of mix =Re 1, Gain% =50/3%             C.P of  1 Litre of Mix =Rs(100 x 3/350 x 1) =Re 6/7 Ratio of water and milk =1/7 = 6/7 = 1: 6

mcqs.question: Milk and water in two vessels A and B are in the ratio 4:3 and 2:3 respectively in what ratio the liquids in both the vessels should be mixed to obtain a new mixture in vessel C containing half milk and half water?
mcqs.explanation: Milk in A=4/7 of whole milk in B=2/5 of whole milk in mixture A and B =1/2 of the whole. Let the C.P of unit quantity be Re.1 Required ratio = 1/10 = 1/14 =14 : 10 =7: 5

mcqs.question: How much water must be added to a bucket which contains 40 liters of milk at the cost price of Rs.3.50 per liter so that the cost of milk reduces to Rs.2 per liter?
mcqs.explanation: Total cost price =Rs(40 x 7/2) = Rs.140 Cost per litre =Rs.2, Total quantity = 140/2 = 70 Litres. Water to be added =(70-40) =30 Litres.

mcqs.question: In what proportion must water be added to spirit to gain 20% by selling it at the cost price?
mcqs.explanation: Let the C.P be Re.1 per liter S.P of 1 litre of mix =Re 1, Gain = 20% C.P of 1 litre mix =Rs(100/120 x 1) =Re(5/6) Ratio of water and spirit = 1/6 =5/6 = 1 : 5.

mcqs.question: A man saves 20% of his monthly salary. If an account of dearness of things he is to increase his monthly expenses by 20%, he is only able to save Rs. 200 per month. What is his monthly salary?

After 38 liters of petrol were poured into the tank, it was still 5% empty. How much petrol must be poured into the tank in order to fill it?

What percent of 125 is 16?
